   Zhang, Xingyu
TI Machine Learning for Personalized Prediction of Electrocardiogram (EKG)
   Use in Emergency Care.
SO Journal of personalized medicine
VL 15
IS 8
DI 10.3390/jpm15080358
DT Journal Article
PD 2025 Aug 06
PY 2025
AB Background: Electrocardiograms (EKGs) are essential tools in emergency
   medicine, often used to evaluate chest pain, dyspnea, and other symptoms
   suggestive of cardiac dysfunction. Yet, EKGs are not universally
   administered to all emergency department (ED) patients. Understanding
   and predicting which patients receive an EKG may offer insights into
   clinical decision making, resource allocation, and potential disparities
   in care. This study examines whether integrating structured clinical
   data with free-text patient narratives can improve prediction of EKG
   utilization in the ED. Methods: We conducted a retrospective
   observational study to predict electrocardiogram (EKG) utilization using
   data from 13,115 adult emergency department (ED) visits in the
   nationally representative 2021 National Hospital Ambulatory Medical Care
   Survey-Emergency Department (NHAMCS-ED), leveraging both structured
   features-demographics, vital signs, comorbidities, arrival mode, and
   triage acuity, with the most influential selected via Lasso
   regression-and unstructured patient narratives transformed into
   numerical embeddings using Clinical-BERT. Four supervised learning
   models-Logistic Regression (LR), Support Vector Machine (SVM), Random
   Forest (RF) and Extreme Gradient Boosting (XGB)-were trained on three
   inputs (structured data only, text embeddings only, and a late-fusion
   combined model); hyperparameters were optimized by grid search with
   5-fold cross-validation; performance was evaluated via AUROC, accuracy,
   sensitivity, specificity and precision; and interpretability was
   assessed using SHAP values and Permutation Feature Importance. Results:
   EKGs were administered in 30.6% of adult ED visits. Patients who
   received EKGs were more likely to be older, White, Medicare-insured, and
   to present with abnormal vital signs or higher triage severity. Across
   all models, the combined data approach yielded superior predictive
   performance. The SVM and LR achieved the highest area under the ROC
   curve (AUC = 0.860 and 0.861) when using both structured and
   unstructured data, compared to 0.772 with structured data alone and
   0.823 and 0.822 with unstructured data alone. Similar improvements were
   observed in accuracy, sensitivity, and specificity. Conclusions:
   Integrating structured clinical data with patient narratives
   significantly enhances the ability to predict EKG utilization in the
   emergency department. These findings support a personalized medicine
   framework by demonstrating how multimodal data integration can enable
   individualized, real-time decision support in the ED.

TI Method for constructing large-scale datasets based            on
   multi-source data aggregation, involves employing            efficient
   distributed database to store cleaned and            aggregated data and

   through API gateway to            support data query, analysis, and
   export
PN CN120429346-A
AE BEIJING BAIJU YIXING TECHNOLOGY CO LTD
AB 
   NOVELTY - The method involves accessing multiple data               
   sources through standardized interface technology                and
   using message queues for real-time data                collection and
   transmission. The received data is                formatted, missing
   values are filled, duplicate                data is removed, and
   preliminary data normalization                is performed. The
   automated data cleaning tools and                a rules engine are used
   to remove noise, validate                and standardize data formats,
   and address outliers.                The different aggregation methods
   for data                integration are adopted based on business needs
   and                data types, and the distributed computing            
   frameworks are integrated to perform parallel               
   computations on large-scale data. An efficient               
   distributed database is employed to store cleaned                and
   aggregated data, and the data storage structure                is
   optimized by combining columnar storage formats                and
   compression technologies to improve storage                efficiency
   and query performance. A RESTful API is                provided through
   an API gateway to support data                query, analysis, and
   export.

   standardize data                formats are removed, thus ensuring data
   consistency                and integrity, by utilizing automated data
   cleaning                tools and a rules engine. The intelligent

   methods such as hash joins,                partition statistics, and
   attribute fusion. The                quality and availability of data
   sets is                significantly improved, and the reliable data    
   support for multiple application scenarios such as                big
   data analysis, machine learning model training,                and
   business intelligence are provided, thus                facilitating
   data-driven decision-making and                intelligent analysis.

   foundation,                thus constructing a multi-level node coupling

   weights. The graph structure continuously and                adaptively
   optimizes scheduling frequency and                resource allocation of

   information loop such as space,                ground, and building.

   governance.

TI MA-MSTNet: mixed attention-based multi-scale temporal network for stock
   trend prediction
SO JOURNAL OF SUPERCOMPUTING
VL 81
IS 12
AR 1207
DI 10.1007/s11227-025-07700-1
DT Article
PD AUG 3 2025
PY 2025
AB Accurate stock trend prediction is vital for financial decision-making,
   yet existing methods struggle to jointly model multivariate correlations
   and multi-scale temporal patterns. We propose MA-MSTNet, a novel Mixed
   Attention-based Multi-Scale Temporal Network that integrates Maximal
   Information Coefficient-guided attention to quantify feature
   dependencies while suppressing noise, multi-scale sliding window
   attention capturing high-to-low frequency features, and dynamic gated
   fusion for adaptive feature integration. Experiments on four stock
   indices (S&P 500, Nasdaq, etc.) demonstrate state-of-the-art performance
   (R2\documentclass[12pt]{minimal} \usepackage{amsmath}
   \usepackage{wasysym} \usepackage{amsfonts} \usepackage{amssymb}
   \usepackage{amsbsy} \usepackage{mathrsfs} \usepackage{upgreek}
   \setlength{\oddsidemargin}{-69pt} \begin{document}$$<^>2$$\end{document}
   up to 0.984), outperforming seven baselines. Crucially, the model
   achieves 6.5ms inference latency and 39% faster training per epoch,
   enabling real-time high-frequency trading.
RI , 张翔/; zhang, xiang/OEO-6627-2025
OI , 张翔/0009-0002-0360-2210;

TI Context-aware generative system for creating            personalized

   dynamically guide the operation of a generative AI                model

TI Gated multilayer perceptron Bayesian fusion network: A geological
   uncertainty-aware network for rate of penetration prediction in the
   nonlinear dynamic system of drill string-formation
SO PHYSICS OF FLUIDS
VL 37
IS 8
AR 086642
DI 10.1063/5.0289249
DT Article
PD AUG 2025
PY 2025
AB Accurate prediction of rate of penetration (ROP) under complex
   geological conditions is a critical task in geological drilling
   operations, yet it remains challenging due to the nonlinear relationship
   of drill string dynamics and uncertainty inherent in subsurface
   formations. This paper proposes a gated MLP (multilayer
   perceptron)-Bayesian fusion network (G-BFNet) model, which integrates
   gated MLP architecture with Bayesian probabilistic inference to enhance
   prediction accuracy and quantify geological uncertainty (GU) in ROP
   forecasting. First, a dual-channel structure is designed to decouple
   engineering parameters and geological inputs, where geological features
   are modeled independently via a Bayesian neural network to ensure
   uncertainty originates solely from formation variability. Then, a
   spatial gating unit is employed to capture depth-dependent lithological
   transitions, while a sliding window mechanism enables dynamic adaptation
   to drilling depth changes. Experimental results based on field data from
   four wells show that G-BFNet consistently outperforms state-of-the-art
   baseline models across multiple prediction horizons (5, 10, and 15 m),
   with improved generalization and robustness in areas with interbedded
   formations and fault zones. Compared to existing models, the mean
   squared error and mean absolute error of G-BFNet are reduced by 33.2%
   and 27.6%, respectively. Furthermore, the proposed model provides
   uncertainty intervals that accurately reflect subsurface structural
   complexity, offering valuable support for real-time drilling risk
   assessment and decision-making. This work demonstrates the potential of
   GU-aware models for reliable and interpretable ROP prediction in complex
   drilling environments.
RI Zhang, Chengkai/PFZ-8565-2026; Yan, Zhi/MEO-7931-2025; Zhu, Zhaopeng/HKF-7406-2023; Pan, Tao/OVZ-6936-2025
OI Pan, Tao/0009-0009-0581-2976

TI Dynamic early warning system for maintenance and            operation
   failures based on high-speed railway            communication network,
   has cross-domain collaboration            module that includes decision
   domain verification unit            includes real-time digital twin
   comparison system and            blockchain evidence storage platform
PN CN120410506-A
AE HEILONGJIANG TRANSPORTATION VOCATIONAL
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system has a digital twin unit that               
   includes a high-precision simulation system                integrating a
   Friis electromagnetic propagation                model and a graphics
   processing unit (GPU)                accelerated Monte Carlo simulation
   engine. A                decision control unit includes an intelligent  
   analysis engine, deploying a Transformer time                series
   model and a Neo4j(RTM: graph database                management system)
   dynamic knowledge graph. A                cross-domain collaboration
   module includes                perception domain processing unit
   implements                spatiotemporal data fusion, and employing a   
   five-dimensional (5D) coordinate system and Kalman               
   filtering technology. The computation domain                scheduling
   unit implements dynamic computing power                scheduling,
   allocating computing power to edge,                onboard, and cloud
   resource pools based on task                requirements. The decision
   domain verification unit                includes a real-time digital
   twin comparison system                and a blockchain evidence storage
   platform.
   USE - Dynamic early warning system for maintenance                and
   operation failures based on high-speed railway               
   communication network used as support of key                services
   such as train operation control and                dispatching command.
   ADVANTAGE - The system solves the problems of inaccurate               
   fault warnings and slow response speeds, utilizes a               
   three-level elastic segment classification, a                four-layer
   intelligent processing module, and a                cross-domain
   collaboration module to achieve                real-time monitoring and
   intelligent analysis of                railway lines. The three-level
   elastic segment                classification dynamically defines
   monitoring                intensity based on the average annual fault
   rate.                The four-layer intelligent processing module       
   includes multi-module perception, edge computing,                digital
   twins, and decision-making control                functions, and the
   cross-domain collaboration                module ensures overall system
   efficiency, also                improves the accuracy and timeliness of
   fault                warnings, reduces maintenance costs, and provides a
   strong guarantee for the safe operation of                high-speed
   railways. The future work continues to                optimize the
   system, explores more application                scenarios, and enhances
   system performance and user                experience.

   operation failures based on a high-speed                railway
   communication network. (Drawing includes                non-English
   language text).

TI Digital twin-stage and self-healing decision            system for oil
   and gas equipment management, has            warning execution terminal
   that uses audible and visual            alarm device to issue graded
   warning instructions, when            system determines that fault
   exceeds limit
PN CN120370707-A
AE HONGYOU SOFTWARE CO LTD
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system has a twin optimization module that               
   collects real-time equipment physical parameters                and
   operating condition data, and uses fluid                dynamics
   equations and material stress models to                determine fault.
   A fault topology diagnosis module                constructs a
   topological relationship diagram of                equipment components
   and divides the fault                propagation path into multiple
   levels. The module                automatically detects the failure
   probability of                component nodes, quantifies the fault
   correlation                of pumps, valves, and pipelines in real time,
   and                generates risk warning instructions in real time     
   based on characteristic values of fault                transmission
   path. The warning execution terminal                uses an audible and
   visual alarm device to issue                graded warning instructions,
   when the system                determines that a fault exceeds a limit,
   a model                mismatch occurs, or in case of an execution      
   anomaly. The edge controller is triggered to                intervene
   and provide the feedback on a manual                intervention signal.
   USE - Digital twin platform and self-healing               
   decision-making system for oil and gas equipment               
   management.
   ADVANTAGE - By establishing a multimodal synchronous               
   fusion mechanism, the system ensures the clarity of               
   multi-source sensor data fusion during oil and gas               
   equipment status monitoring by establishing                heterogeneous
   data alignment standards and setting                dynamic frequency
   normalization rules for different                equipment types.
   Simultaneously, vibration,                temperature, pressure, and
   acoustic wave data are                collected in real time, enabling
   millisecond-level                detection and elimination of data time
   differences,                ensuring the accuracy of equipment status
   feature                extraction and further reducing feature fusion   
   errors. Furthermore, by establishing a dual-track               
   drive-topology diagnosis model, the system                generates
   adaptive correction coefficients in real                time by
   calculating the dynamic deviation between                the physical
   model and the data model during                equipment fault analysis.
   DESCRIPTION Of DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a schematic system

   self-healing decision-making system for oil and gas               
   equipment management. (Drawing includes non-English               
   language text).

AB 
   NOVELTY - The system has a central data processing                server
   (1) that is equipped with high-performance                processors
   that coordinate data processing,                analysis and simulation
   processes. A relational                database management system (2)
   stores spatial                measurements, socio-economic data and
   simulation                results in structured tables and performs data
   manipulation with SQL-based query language. An                integrated
   data unit (3) includes data and analysis                modules. A data
   collection module (3.1)                standardizes, validates and
   transfers data obtained                from interviews with residents to
   the database.                Visualization tool (5.2) for analysis
   results that                visualizes the results in the form of tables
   and                diagrams. The scenario creation tool (5.3) allows    
   users to create different intervention scenarios                and
   predict the effects of scenarios. A reporting                tool (5.4)
   allows users to export analysis results                as documents. A
   client (6) allows users to use this                service via devices
   such as mobile or                computer.
   USE - User-friendly system for analyzing changes               
   occurring in rural housing spaces, integrating                space
   syntax with system dynamics to analyze, plan                and control
   morphological and social changes in                rural housing spaces,
   and used by rural development                agencies, local governments
   and academic                researchers to test planning policies to
   ensure                sustainability of housing and preserve cultural   
               heritage.
   ADVANTAGE - The system can analyze morphological and               
   social changes occurring in rural housing spaces                with
   interdisciplinary system, dynamically assess                the impact
   of changes on housing authenticity and                livability, and
   provide data-based solutions for                planning processes. The
   system can prevent problems                such as uncontrolled changes
   threatening cultural                heritage or housing abandonment, and
   contribute to                sustainable rural development goals. By
   testing                different intervention scenarios on the system,
   the                users can visualize the impact of the change on      
   housing lifespan, habitability, and loss of                original
   value in real time. The system allows                local governments
   and rural development agencies to                efficiently optimize
   the decision-making processes.                The system enables dynamic
   intervention through                real-time data integration. By
   continuously                updating survey data, spatial measurements,
   and                socio-economic indicators, the system quickly        
   adapts to changing conditions and allows users to                make
   instantaneous policy adjustments. The system                can provide
   low-cost, and can be easily integrated                with data from
   different rural regions, expanded by                adding additional
   parameters, and used by public                institutions without
   requiring additional technical                investment. The system
   supports sustainable                development by increasing resource
   efficiency in                rural areas.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The system has a demographic analysis module     
   (3.2) that evaluates the density of housing use,               
   population dynamics and spatial needs by processing                the
   number of people living parameter. A                socio-economic
   analysis module (3.3) that evaluates                the economic
   situation of residents, renovation and                maintenance
   capacity by processing the income level                parameter. A
   space syntax analysis module (3.4)                calculates the true
   relative asymmetry (RRA)                parameter by mathematically
   modeling the spatial                organization of the house and
   digitizes the                relationships between the spaces. A spatial
   depth                analysis module (3.5) that calculates the mean     
   depth (MD) parameter by measuring the spatial depth                of
   the house and digitizes the accessibility level.                An
   architectural assessment module (3.6) calculates                the
   originality value of the house by evaluating                its unique
   architectural features and determines                the value of the
   house in terms of cultural                heritage. A policy impact
   analysis module (3.11)                provides policy recommendations by
   modeling the                impact of government incentives and
   simulates the                effects of different incentive mechanisms
   on                housing sustainability. A cloud-based computing       
   unit (4) performs the computationally intensive               
   operations of the system in parallel and enables                complex
   simulations to be run quickly and                efficiently. A
   simulation module (5) produces                computational results
   based on parameters specified                by users. Data entry form
   (5.1) allows users to                enter data into the system and is
   equipped with                data validation controls.

   user-friendly system for analyzing changes                occurring in

PT J
AU Venkata Siva, O.
   Anbarasi, M. S.
TI A Federated Graph-Based Multimodal AI Framework for Privacy-Preserving
   and Explainable Osteoporosis Detection
SO INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL ON ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE TOOLS
VL 34
IS 02N03
DI 10.1142/S0218213025500095
EA JUL 2025
DT Article
PD MAY 2025
PY 2025
AB Osteoporosis is a progressive skeletal disorder characterized by
   decreased Bone Mineral Density (BMD) and structural deterioration,
   leading to an increased risk of fractures. Traditional diagnostic
   methods, such as Dual-Energy X-ray Absorptiometry (DXA) and the Fracture
   Risk Assessment Tool (FRAX), often fail to detect osteoporosis at an
   early stage due to their limited sensitivity and accessibility. Recent
   advancements in Artificial Intelligence (AI), Deep Learning (DL), and
   Machine Learning (ML) have shown significant potential in improving
   osteoporosis detection. However, existing models face challenges related
   to data privacy, explainability, computational complexity, and
   generalizability across diverse populations. This study introduces
   Federated Graph-based Multimodal Osteoporosis Diagnosis (FGMOD), a novel
   AI-driven framework that integrates Federated Learning (FL) and Graph
   Neural Networks (GNNs) for enhanced osteoporosis risk assessment. Unlike
   traditional DL models that rely on centralized training, FL ensures
   privacy-preserving learning across multiple hospitals and institutions.
   Simultaneously, GNNs model trabecular bone connectivity, offering deeper
   insights into microarchitectural changes in osteoporotic bones.
   Multimodal data fusion, incorporating structured clinical data, DXA
   scans, and biochemical markers, significantly improves prediction
   accuracy and interpretability. The proposed FGMOD model was validated on
   a real-world dataset comprising 10 000 patient records, 5000 DXA scans,
   and biochemical profiles. Comparative evaluation with state-of-the-art
   AI models demonstrated superior performance, achieving 94.2% accuracy,
   93.4% precision, 93.1% recall, and a ROC-AUC score of 0.96. Unlike
   CNN-based models, which rely heavily on high-resolution images, FGMOD
   effectively extracts clinically relevant features from graph-based bone
   connectivity analysis, ensuring robust and interpretable predictions.
   Furthermore, the use of SHAP-based feature importance analysis provides
   clinicians with an explainable AI decision-making process, enhancing
   trust in the model's recommendations. Performance comparisons against
   CNN, Gradient Boosting, Random Forest, and Transfer Learning models
   revealed that FGMOD outperformed all baselines, particularly in
   privacy-aware federated training, osteoporosis risk stratification, and
   real-time inference on edge AI devices. Additionally, FGMOD reduced
   inference latency to 45 ms per sample, making it suitable for real-time
   clinical deployment. FGMOD represents a significant advancement in
   AI-powered osteoporosis detection, addressing key challenges such as
   privacy, generalizability, and interpretability. Future research should
   focus on expanding FL collaborations across global hospitals,
   integrating wearable sensor data for continuous bone health monitoring,
   and enhancing GNN-based osteoporosis modeling for faster inference on
   mobile healthcare platforms. This study paves the way for clinically
   reliable, privacy-preserving, and scalable AI solutions in osteoporosis
   risk assessment and early detection.
RI Anbarasi, M S/AFE-8385-2022
ZA 0
Z8 0
ZR 0
TC 0
ZS 0

   strategies. The system enables                proactive decision-making,
   carbon-smart load                management and seamless integration of
   renewable                energies, thus promoting sustainable
   manufacturing                ecosystems. The optimization module
   performs                multi-criteria optimization to minimize the

AU Farrugia, Lizzy
   Azzopardi, Lilian M.

   Abela, Charlie
TI medicX-KG: a knowledge graph for pharmacists' drug information needs
SO JOURNAL OF BIOMEDICAL SEMANTICS
VL 16
IS 1
AR 11
DI 10.1186/s13326-025-00332-7
DT Article
PD JUL 1 2025
PY 2025
AB The role of pharmacists is evolving from medicine dispensing to
   delivering comprehensive pharmaceutical services within
   multidisciplinary healthcare teams. Central to this shift is access to
   accurate, up-to-date medicinal product information supported by robust
   data integration. Leveraging artificial intelligence and semantic
   technologies, Knowledge Graphs (KGs) uncover hidden relationships and
   enable data-driven decision-making. This paper presents medicX-KG, a
   pharmacist-oriented knowledge graph supporting clinical and regulatory
   decisions. It forms the semantic layer of the broader medicX platform,
   powering predictive and explainable pharmacy services. medicX-KG
   integrates data from three sources, including, the British National
   Formulary (BNF), DrugBank, and the Malta Medicines Authority (MMA) that
   addresses Malta's regulatory landscape and combines European Medicines
   Agency alignment with partial UK supply dependence. The KG tackles the
   absence of a unified national drug repository, reducing pharmacists'
   reliance on fragmented sources. Its design was informed by interviews
   with practising pharmacists to ensure real-world applicability. We
   detail the KG's construction, including data extraction, ontology
   design, and semantic mapping. Evaluation demonstrates that medicX-KG
   effectively supports queries about drug availability, interactions,
   adverse reactions, and therapeutic classes. Limitations, including
   missing detailed dosage encoding and real-time updates, are discussed
   alongside directions for future enhancements.
RI Azzopardi, Lilian/H-6982-2019; Abela, Charlie/
OI Abela, Charlie/0000-0002-7574-4296

ZA 0
ZS 0
ZB 0
ZR 0
Z8 0
Z9 0
U1 5
U2 5
SN 2041-1480
DA 2025-07-07
UT WOS:001520762400001
PM 40597373
ER

PT J
AU Mahe, Cedric
   Kannt, Aimo
CA AIOLOS Consortium
TI Policy makers must adopt agile signal detection tools to strengthen
   epidemiological surveillance and improve pandemic preparedness
SO HEALTH POLICY
VL 159
AR 105386
DI 10.1016/j.healthpol.2025.105386
EA JUL 2025
DT Article
PD SEP 2025
PY 2025
AB The SARS-COV2 pandemic has highlighted the urgent need for agile and
   responsive disease surveillance systems. To strengthen epidemiological
   surveillance and improve pandemic preparedness, policymakers must adopt
   realtime signal detection tools that integrate multisource data,
   including non-traditional health data, advanced analytics, and
   artificial intelligence (AI). Such approaches enable more efficient
   monitoring and decision-making through collaborative networks. Expanding
   these agile tools across Europe under a supranational mandate would
   enhance public health outcomes, support healthcare system efficiency,
   and increase business resilience. Leveraging private sector data and
   ensuring modularity for gradual scale-up are essential to maintaining
   adaptability and responsiveness.
RI Kannt, Aimo/AAZ-6898-2020

PT J
AU Tu, Jun
TI Enterprise financial management information fusion processing based on
   integrated framework construction and evolutionary game model
SO JOURNAL OF COMPUTATIONAL METHODS IN SCIENCES AND ENGINEERING
DI 10.1177/14727978251352159
EA JUN 2025
DT Article; Early Access
PY 2025
AB To achieve efficient sharing and integrated development of financial
   information resources, the study proposes a blockchain-based financial
   management system. The system combines a server-side architecture with a
   modular data processing integration framework for seamless data flow, a
   dynamic game framework with group analysis strategy adaptation for
   dynamically mitigating 51% ledger attacks, and a hybrid tree structure
   for secure and efficient key-value storage in blockchain, as well as
   high fidelity data fusion for state trees, to solve the key challenges
   of secure and efficient financial data integration in enterprises. The
   results showed that the attack success rate was reduced by 91.2%, and
   the consensus latency was lower than 90 seconds (more than 10% higher
   than other consensus mechanism algorithms). The average data storage
   accuracy was over 90%, which was at least 5% more than that of
   cloud/distributed systems. The memory occupation result was no more than
   1500 kb when the number of datasets was 5000, which was much smaller
   than 1906 kb and 2341 kb of distributed storage and cloud storage,
   respectively. The operation efficiency of the core financial function
   under the method was over 90%. The financial information management
   system can effectively add, modify, delete, and query voucher
   management, cashier management, and accounting information management.
   The proposed method can provide a secure and scalable solution for
   real-time financial decision-making in dynamic market conditions.

EI 1875-8983

TI Navigation system for autonomous vehicle, has deep           
   reinforcement learning module and sensor fusion engine            that
   integrates heterogeneous sensor data using            extended Kalman
   filter to produce reliable real-time            state estimations
PN IN202541057253-A
AE HUSSAIN J S; SELVAKUMAR M; ISAKKI M A R; PRABHU S S; CHAKRABORTY P;
   THARINI C; KALAIVANI S
AB 
   NOVELTY - The navigation system has multiple sensors               
   including light detection and ranging (LiDAR),                radar,
   camera, global positioning system (GPS), and                inertial
   measurement unit (IMU). A sensor fusion                engine integrates
   heterogeneous sensor data using                an extended Kalman filter
   to produce reliable                real-time state estimations. A deep
   reinforcement                learning module utilizes the deep
   deterministic                policy gradient (DDPG) algorithm to
   generate                adaptive navigation policies based on fused
   sensor                inputs. A control system interprets defence       
   research laboratory (DRL)-derived commands and                executes
   safe navigation actions. A safety module                monitors DRL
   decisions and overrides them using a                rule-based fallback
   in the event of a potential                failure. The combination of
   multisensor data fusion                and deep reinforcement learning
   provides enhanced                navigation performance and robustness
   compared to                traditional approaches.
            USE - Navigation system for autonomous                vehicles.
   ADVANTAGE - The system provides robust real-time               
   decision-making that adapts to dynamic                environments,
   improves over time through learning,                and retains safety
   through fallback mechanisms, and                offers superior
   performance over traditional                rule-based or single-sensor
   systems.

TI Intelligent decision support system for financial            risk
   assessment, has integration and automation            framework that
   facilitates real-time data exchange and            workflow
   orchestration with external financial            systems
PN IN202521054830-A
AE RAJNANDINI; KUSHWAH P; SOLANKI V; PUROHIT S; CHATURVEDI S; BARMAN S;
   KUMARI S; SHILEDAR S N; VASHISHTHA S
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system has a data acquisition module for               
   collecting and aggregating financial data from               
   heterogeneous sources including market data feeds,                credit
   reports, transactional records, and                unstructured data
   sources. A data preprocessing and                feature engineering
   module cleanses, normalizes,                and transforms raw data into
   structured features                relevant for risk modeling. A
   predictive modeling                engine employs machine learning and
   deep learning                algorithms to analyze the processed data
   and                generate risk predictions. A risk scoring module     
   synthesizes predictive outputs into composite risk                scores
   with associated confidence metrics. An                integration and
   automation framework facilitates                real-time data exchange
   and workflow orchestration                with external financial
   systems.
   USE - Intelligent decision support system for                financial
   risk assessment for financial                institutions and
   businesses.
   ADVANTAGE - The system facilitates accurate, real-time,               
   and actionable risk insights that support informed               
   decision-making for financial institutions, asset               
   managers, regulators, and corporate finance                professionals
   by integrating heterogeneous                financial data from multiple
   sources and applying                state-of-the-art machine learning
   and explainable                artificial intelligence techniques. The
   system                significantly improves the accuracy,              
   responsiveness, and interpretability of financial                risk
   assessments, facilitating informed and timely                decisions
   in complex financial environments. The                intelligent
   decision support system systematically                orchestrates data
   science pipelines-from data                ingestion to predictive risk
   scoring-leveraging                machine learning, data fusion, and
   explainability                techniques to enhance financial risk
   assessment                accuracy, robustness, and operational         
         efficiency.

TI Enhanced ping pong training assessment via VR: integrating time-spatial
   alignment and multi-modal fusion
SO VISUAL COMPUTER
VL 41
IS 13
BP 10617
EP 10633
DI 10.1007/s00371-025-04058-6
EA JUN 2025
DT Article
PD OCT 2025
PY 2025
AB We present an innovative method for evaluating the performance level of
   ping pong trainees through the integration of virtual reality (VR)
   technology and multi-camera data fusion. Traditional ping pong training
   evaluations often rely on subjective assessments, which can be
   inaccurate. To address these limitations, we propose a comprehensive
   evaluation framework that utilizes the time and spatial alignment of VR
   handles, combined with synchronized data from two cameras capturing the
   trainee's movements and the ball's trajectory within the VR 3D space.
   This data fusion approach enables a more accurate and objective
   assessment of trainee performance. Our evaluation metrics are organized
   into five main categories: basic actions, tactics, physical fitness,
   scoring, and spin and net clearance trajectory. A key novelty of this
   study is the expansion of these five categories into 55 detailed
   evaluation metrics, providing a granular and multifaceted analysis of
   trainee skills. The methodology involves precise synchronization and
   alignment of data from the VR handles and cameras, allowing for
   real-time tracking and analysis of both the trainee's actions and the
   ball's dynamics. The results demonstrate that our system can effectively
   differentiate between various skill levels, offering detailed insights
   for personalized training programs. The detailed metrics enable coaches
   and trainees to identify specific strengths and areas for improvement,
   such as stroke mechanics, tactical decision-making, and physical
   conditioning. This framework maintains good consistency with the current
   popular standard, "China Table Tennis Association's Level Evaluation
   Standard and Guidelines for Table Tennis," while significantly enhancing
   the objectivity and detail of the evaluation process.
RI Wang, Jinyang/AES-2711-2022
OI Wang, Jinyang/0000-0003-4372-6920

AU Pal, Gautam
TI Improving personalized healthcare with automated longitudinal EHR
   analysis
SO INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF MEDICAL INFORMATICS
VL 203
AR 106010
DI 10.1016/j.ijmedinf.2025.106010
EA JUN 2025
DT Article
PD NOV 2025
PY 2025
AB Background: Traditional Electronic Health Record (EHR) data analysis at
   King's College Hospital relies on extensive manual effort, from data
   extraction to reporting, limiting efficiency and scalability. This study
   presents an automated framework for longitudinal EHR data analysis to
   enhance personalized healthcare insights. Methods: Central to the
   framework is the integration of Markov Chains with Survival Analysis
   (SA) and Latent Growth Modeling, enhancing the modeling of patient
   trajectories and capturing variances in growth patterns over time.
   Expectation-Maximization with Gaussian Mixture Models, extended with
   Latent Class Analysis, identifies clinically meaningful patient
   subgroups for tailored interventions. The framework addresses data
   uncertainty, enabling precise event forecasts and trajectory
   predictions. The system employs Apache NiFi for data ingestion,
   Elasticsearch for indexing, and Splunk and Kibana for real-time
   visualization and reporting. Natural Language Processing (NLP)
   techniques extract structured insights from unstructured clinical notes,
   enriching datasets with context. The automation significantly reduces
   manual processing while ensuring data integrity and enhancing predictive
   capabilities. Main findings: Implementation demonstrated a 15% increase
   in detecting major depression cases, an 18% improvement in predicting
   patient decisions, a 25% reduction in growth trajectory prediction
   variance, and a 10% increase in event prediction accuracy. The framework
   enhances data-driven decision-making, supporting personalized healthcare
   interventions through real-time insights. Conclusions: This automated
   framework integrates predictive modeling, NLP techniques, and real-time
   data processing, improving the efficiency and accuracy of longitudinal
   EHR analysis. Providing robust, actionable insights enables personalized
   healthcare delivery, enhances clinical decision-making, and optimizes
   patient outcomes.
OI Pal, Gautam/0000-0002-2594-9699

AU Mu, Cong
   Chang, Chen
   Huo, Jiuyuan
   Yang, Jiguang
TI Deflection Prediction of Highway Bridges Using Wireless Sensor Networks
   and Enhanced iTransformer Model
SO BUILDINGS
VL 15
IS 13
AR 2176
DI 10.3390/buildings15132176
DT Article
PD JUN 22 2025
PY 2025
AB As an important part of national transportation infrastructure, the
   operation status of bridges is directly related to transportation safety
   and social stability. Structural deflection, which reflects the
   deformation behavior of bridge systems, serves as a key indicator for
   identifying stiffness degradation and the progression of localized
   damage. The accurate modeling and forecasting of deflection are thus
   essential for effective bridge health monitoring and intelligent
   maintenance. To address the limitations of traditional methods in
   handling multi-source data fusion and nonlinear temporal dependencies,
   this study proposes an enhanced iTransformer-based prediction model,
   termed LDAiT (LSTM Differential Attention iTransformer), which
   integrates Long Short-Term Memory (LSTM) networks and a differential
   attention mechanism for high-fidelity deflection prediction under
   complex working conditions. Firstly, a multi-source heterogeneous time
   series dataset is constructed based on wireless sensor network (WSN)
   technology, enabling the real-time acquisition and fusion of key
   structural response parameters such as deflection, strain, and
   temperature across critical bridge sections. Secondly, LDAiT enhances
   the modeling capability of long-term dependence through the introduction
   of LSTM and combines with the differential attention mechanism to
   improve the precision of response to the local dynamic changes in
   disturbance. Finally, experimental validation is carried out based on
   the measured data of Xintian Yellow River Bridge, and the results show
   that LDAiT outperforms the existing mainstream models in the indexes of
   R2, RMSE, MAE, and MAPE and has good accuracy, stability and
   generalization ability. The proposed approach offers a novel and
   effective framework for deflection forecasting in complex bridge systems
   and holds significant potential for practical deployment in structural
   health monitoring and intelligent decision-making applications.
OI Huo, Jiuyuan/0000-0003-2395-4133; yang, jiguang/0000-0001-7877-8566;
   Chang, Chen/0000-0002-8861-8694

TI MSKT: multimodal data fusion for improved nursing management in
   hemorrhagic stroke
SO PEERJ COMPUTER SCIENCE
VL 11
AR e2969
DI 10.7717/peerj-cs.2969
DT Article
PD JUN 20 2025
PY 2025
AB Background The study aims to address the challenges of nursing
   decision-making and the optimization of personalized nursing plans in
   the management of hemorrhagic stroke. Due to the rapid progression and
   high complexity of hemorrhagic stroke, traditional nursing methods
   struggle to cope with the challenges posed by its high incidence and
   high disability rate. Methods To address this, we propose an innovative
   approach based on multimodal data fusion and a non-stationary Gaussian
   process model. Utilizing multidimensional data from the MIMIC-IV
   database (including patient medical history, nursing records, laboratory
   test results, etc.), we developed a hybrid predictive model with a
   multiscale kernel transformer non-stationary Gaussian process
   (MSKT-NSGP) architecture to handle non-stationary time-series data and
   capture the dynamic changes in a patient's condition. Results The
   proposed MSKT-NSGP model outperformed traditional algorithms in
   prediction accuracy, computational efficiency, and uncertainty handling.
   For hematoma expansion prediction, it achieved 85.5% accuracy, an area
   under the curve (AUC) of 0.87, and reduced mean squared error (MSE) by
   18% compared to the sparse variational Gaussian process (SVGP). With an
   inference speed of 55 milliseconds per sample, it supports real-time
   predictions. The model maintained a confidence interval coverage near
   95% with narrower widths, indicating precise uncertainty estimation.
   These results highlight its potential to enhance nursing
   decision-making, optimize personalized plans, and improve patient
   outcomes.
ZS 0
ZB 0
TC 0
Z8 0
ZA 0
ZR 0
Z9 0
U1 2
U2 3
EI 2376-5992
DA 2025-07-01
UT WOS:001516894200001
PM 40567743
ER

TI System for realizing automated loan sanctioning            and real-time
   data integration in financial services            sector by integration
   of artificial intelligence and            real-time data analytics, has

             enabling users to check loan eligibility
PN IN202541050431-A
AE UNIV SR
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system has a decision engine (114) for               
   approving or rejecting loan applications based on                outputs
   from a machine learning engine (106),                explainable
   artificial intelligence (XAI) module                (110), and an
   alternative credit scoring module                (112). A document
   generation unit (116)                automatically generates and issues
   a sanction                letter upon loan approval. A fund disbursement
   module (118) initiates the release of sanctioned                loan
   amounts to approved applicants. A post-loan                monitoring
   module (120) tracks borrower behavior                and loan repayment

PT J
AU Ji, Xiao
   Liu, Peng
   Zhang, Meng
   Zhang, Chengchun
   Yu, Shuang
   Qi, Bing
   Zhao, Man
TI Multi-Source Data-Driven Terrestrial Multi-Algorithm Fusion Path
   Planning Technology
SO SENSORS
VL 25
IS 12
AR 3595
DI 10.3390/s25123595
DT Article
PD JUN 7 2025
PY 2025
AB This paper presents a multi-source data-driven hybrid path planning
   framework that integrates global A* search with local Deep Q-Network
   (DQN) optimization to address complex terrestrial routing challenges. By
   fusing ASTER GDEM terrain data with OpenStreetMap (OSM) road networks,
   we construct a standardized geospatial database encompassing elevation,
   traffic, and road attributes. A dynamic-heuristic A* algorithm is
   proposed, incorporating traffic signals and congestion penalties, and is
   enhanced by a DQN-based local decision module to improve adaptability to
   dynamic environments. Experimental results on a realistic urban dataset
   demonstrate that the proposed method achieves superior performance in
   risk avoidance, travel time reduction, and dynamic obstacle handling
   compared to traditional models. This study contributes a unified
   architecture that enhances planning robustness and lays the foundation
   for real-time applications in emergency response and smart logistics.
ZS 0
ZB 0
ZR 0
Z8 0
TC 0
ZA 0
Z9 0

U2 13

TI Method for diagnosing vibration fault of condensed            water pump
   shafting based on multi-parameter analysis,            involves
   combining torque fluctuation frequency            spectrum
   characteristic and fault probability            distribution with
   history fault case base
PN CN120102140-A; CN120102140-B
AE ZHEJIANG KEWEI ENERGY SAVING TECHNOLOGY
AB 
   NOVELTY - The method involves constructing a               
   multi-dimensional feature matrix containing energy               
   entropy, phase difference and working condition               
   parameters. The multi-dimensional feature matrix is               
   inputted into the improved lightweight residual                network
   for preliminary fault classification, and                the fault
   probability distribution is outputted.                The torque
   fluctuation signal collected by the                torque meter is fused
   through the fuzzy inference                engine, and the torque
   fluctuation spectrum                characteristics and fault
   probability distribution                is obtained after spectrum
   analysis. The historical                fault case library is combined
   for multi-level                decision-making to generate the final
   fault type,                confidence and fault location information.
   The                alarm threshold is dynamically optimized based on    
   the accumulated operating time, load rate and                ambient
   temperature of the equipment, and trigger                the graded
   warning strategy.
   USE - Method for diagnosing vibration fault of                condensed
   water pump shafting based on                multi-parameter analysis in
   factory device for                public and auxiliary engineering.
   ADVANTAGE - The problem of signal distortion and noise               
   interference of the sensor under high temperature                and
   high humidity condition of the condensed water                pump is
   solved through multi-source data fusion and                environment
   self-adaptive compensation. The dynamic                time-frequency
   domain feature extraction and                improved light residual
   error network are adopted                to realize the high-efficiency
   decoupling and                precise identification of the multi-fault 
   concurrent feature. The fuzzy reasoning rule base                and the
   shafting fluctuation transmission model are                combined,
   which obviously improves the fault                locating precision and
   early fault detection rate,                provides scientific and
   reliable technical support                for the diagnosis and
   maintenance of the                condensation water pump shafting
   vibration fault,                and effectively ensures the safe and
   stable                operation of the factory device.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The method involves collecting vibration         
   signals through axial vibration sensors and radial               
   vibration sensors, collecting torque fluctuation                signals
   through torque meters, collect cooling                water temperature
   through temperature sensors,                collect motor current
   parameters through Hall                sensors, and obtain water pump
   speed data in real                time. The environmental adaptive
   preprocessing is                performed on the vibration signal,
   including signal                correction and anti-aliasing filtering
   based on                temperature drift compensation, to generate a   
   denoised multi-channel time domain signal. The                working
   condition adaptive time-frequency domain                joint analysis
   method is adopted, dynamic wavelet                packet decomposition
   and energy-phase correlation                feature extraction is
   performed on the denoised                multi-channel time domain
   signal.INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:(1) a condensed water pump
   shafting vibration                fault diagnosis device based on
   multi-parameter                analysis; and(2) a computer readable
   storage medium storing                program for condensed water pump
   shafting vibration                fault diagnosis;
   DESCRIPTION Of DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a block flow diagram      
   illustrating the process for diagnosing vibration                fault
   of condensed water pump shafting.

   adjust navigation path of            robot

AE FUJIAN COLLEGE WATER CONSERVANCY & ELECT
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system has an optical imaging sensor               
   provided with a high-resolution camera and an image               
   processing unit, for capturing underwater images                and
   performing object recognition and                classification. An
   electromagnetic field sensor is                provided with an electric
   field detector and a                magnetic field detector, for
   detecting                electromagnetic field changes in the underwater
   environment. A central processing unit is provided                with a
   data fusion processor, an adaptive algorithm                adjustment
   unit, a navigation decision unit, an                obstacle avoidance
   unit, a user interaction                interface and an operation
   control panel. The                obstacle avoidance unit monitors
   obstacles on the                path in real time and generates obstacle
   avoidance                strategies to adjust the navigation path of the
   robot. The user interaction interface graphically               
   displays sensor data, environmental models,                navigation

AE BAODING MAOXING INFORMATION TECHNOLOGY
AB 
   NOVELTY - The method involves using (S1) 10 Gigabit

   virtualization technology is used (S2) to                divide physical
   servers into virtual machines. The                Ceph and other
   distributed file systems are used                (S3) to achieve data
   redundant storage and high                availability. The multi-source
   data acquisition and                monitoring data quality are
   performed (S4) by data                acquisition module. A relational
   database data                warehouse is built (S6), and a data life
   cycle                management platform is established. An automatic

   Ethernetto build a high-speed core network by                network

   intelligently schedule traffic, and                using CDN to cache
   static data to nodes near the                user to improve
   transmission speed. The KVM                virtualization technology is
   used (S2) to divide                physical servers into virtual
   machines by resource                scheduling module, Docker
   containerization                technology is combined to improve
   resource                utilization and application isolation, and      
   real-time monitoring and dynamic allocation of                resources
   are performed. The Ceph and other                distributed file
   systems are used (S3) to achieve                data redundant storage
   and high availability by                data storage module, and data
   are automatically                repaired and balanced. The multi-source
   data                acquisition and real-time monitoring data quality

   are integrated (S5) from different data                sources by data
   integration module, data cleaning                is performed, and data
   formats and structures are                converted, and stored in a
   data warehouse or data                lake. A relational database data
   warehouse is built                (S6), a data life cycle management
   platform is                established, and the entire data process is
   managed                by data management module. The backup and
   recovery                strategies are formulated to ensure data
   security.                An automatic model update mechanism is
   established                (S7), multi-source data fusion analysis is   
   performed, and potential relationships are mined by                data
   analysis module. The visual analysis tools are                integrated
   (S8) and an intuitive and easy-to-use                interface are
   provided by result display module.                The data storage and

   (S10) to monitor                system operation in real time by
   monitoring                management module.An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is

TI Deep Learning-Based Decision Support System for Nurse Staff in Hospitals
SO BIG DATA
DI 10.1089/big.2024.0122
EA JUN 2025
DT Article; Early Access
PY 2025
AB To promote the informatization management of hospital human resources
   and advance the application of hospital information technology. The
   application of deep learning (DL) technologies in health care,
   particularly in hospital settings, has shown significant promise in
   enhancing decision-making processes for nurse staff. Utilizing a
   hospital management decision support system based on data warehouse
   theory and business intelligence technology to achieve multidimensional
   analysis and display of data. This research explores the development and
   implementation of a DL-Based Clinical Decision Support System (DL-CDSS)
   tailored for nurses in hospitals. DL-CDSS utilizes advanced neural
   network architectures to analyze complex clinical data, including
   patient records, vital signs, and diagnostic reports, aiming to assist
   nurses in making informed decisions regarding patient care. By
   leveraging large-scale datasets from Hospital Information Systems,
   DL-CDSS provides real-time recommendations for treatment plans,
   medication administration, and patient monitoring. The system's
   effectiveness is demonstrated through improved accuracy in clinical
   decision-making, reduction in medication errors, and optimized workflow
   efficiency. The system analyzes and displays nurses data from hospitals
   in terms of quantity, distribution, structure, forecasting, analysis
   reports, and peer comparisons, providing head nurses with multilevel,
   multiperspective data mining analysis results. Challenges such as data
   integration, model interpretability, and user interface design are
   addressed to ensure seamless integration into nursing practice, also
   concludes with insights into the potential benefits of DL-CDSS in
   promoting patient safety, enhancing health care quality, and supporting
   nursing professionals in delivering optimal care.

ZS 0

TI Online News-Based Economic Sentiment Index
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON BIG DATA
VL 11
IS 3
BP 1464
EP 1474
DI 10.1109/TBDATA.2024.3474211
DT Article
PD JUN 2025
PY 2025
AB The accurate prediction of industry trends has become increasingly
   challenging because of unforeseen events. To address this challenge,
   this study proposes a deep learning approach to generate an economic
   sentiment index by integrating Natural Language Processing (NLP) models
   and image-clustering techniques. We first employ sampling techniques to
   create standardized online news datasets. Feature engineering techniques
   from the Korean Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers
   (KoBERT) model are then used to generate relevance and sentiment scores
   for the textual data. Further, to enhance visualization and clustering,
   we transform the textual data into joint plot images, which are grouped
   into distinct clusters based on news categories. Finally, using
   Multi-criteria Decision Analysis, the various scores and cluster
   information are synthesized to generate the final economic sentiment
   index. This approach improves visualization and enhances the
   interpretability of the generated index. The proposed algorithm is
   applied to construct a new economic sentiment index for the Information
   and Communications Technology (ICT) industry in South Korea.
RI Choeh, Joon Yeon/JFA-2309-2023; Ko, Dong-Whan/; KANG, NATHANIEL/GLQ-5278-2022
OI Choeh, Joon Yeon/0000-0002-6604-5944; Ko, Dong-Whan/0000-0001-8149-1726;
   KANG, NATHANIEL/0000-0002-6305-7341
TC 0

ZB 0
Z8 0
ZA 0

Z9 0
U1 3
U2 3
SN 2332-7790
DA 2025-05-22
UT WOS:001488533700041

AU Rakotoarison, Tsiorinantenaina Rene
   Hajalalaina, Aime Richard
TI Real-time geo-decisional system for risk and disaster management in
   Madagascar
SO REPORTS ON GEODESY AND GEOINFORMATICS
VL 119
IS 1
BP 7
EP 13
DI 10.2478/rgg-2025-0002
DT Article
PD JUN 1 2025
PY 2025
AB Climate change is intensifying extreme phenomena, and the world is
   increasingly vulnerable to a variety of disasters whose impacts are
   considerable and varied over time, from one place to another and from
   one community to another. Due to its geographical location, Madagascar
   is the most cyclone-prone country in Africa and the ninth most
   vulnerable country in the world. Almost every year, Madagascar is hit by
   cyclones, causing loss of life and property for the population. In terms
   of prevention, Madagascar already has an early warning system to inform
   the population, but during a crisis, it still lacks a decision support
   system for rapid, real-time intervention to minimize damage. In this
   paper, we propose a real-time geo-decision support system based on
   real-time data integration, real-time ETL and real-time cube building.
   In the proposed architecture, continuous data & ring;ow is required for
   real-time data integration. The proposed real-time ETL unit is composed
   of the capitalization of risk analysis experiments to ensure their
   reusability, as well as the insertion of processing parallelization to
   optimize the processing time of voluminous data. The real-time SOLAP
   unit consists of real-time cube formation using a spatial database that
   stores spatio-temporal data from a given point in time, with query
   optimization using materialized query technology. Our prototype uses
   NASA's weather data streaming service via an API. The ETL is written in
   a Matlab script and loads the data into a spatial database in Postgresql
   after processing. A web mapping application queries the constitution of
   a cube and displays the result for visualization.

   response network that integrates multiple data                sources

   in real-time. A predictive                model for disaster forecasting
   using historical and                real-time data through machine
   learning                algorithms.

   prediction, efficient resource allocation, and                optimized
   relief coordination.
   ADVANTAGE - The network: anticipates disasters and acts               
   before the crisis worsens; dynamically assigns                teams and
   supplies to maximize impact; provides a                unified platform
   for governments, non-governmental                organizations and
   responders to collaborate; and                can be deployed in urban
   or rural areas and adapted                to various types of disasters.
   The system:                leverages machine learning, computer vision,
   and                internet of things sensor data fusion to enhance     
   situational awareness and automate emergency               
   decision-making during natural and man-made                disasters;
   provides early warnings; optimizes                relief operations; and
   ensures transparency and                coordination among stakeholders
   with increasing                frequency of climate-induced disasters.

   allocation, route optimization, and public                alerts based
   on live disaster assessments, where                centralized
   coordination dashboard is accessible by                various agencies
   to ensure synchronized response                strategies, and
   edge-enabled disaster detection                mechanism that functions
   even with intermittent                internet connectivity for remote
   or                infrastructure-poor zones; anda self-learning module
   that improves response                strategies based on prior disaster
   outcomes and                post-disaster analysis, where integration
   with                mobile networks and satellite communication for     
   public alert broadcasting and data transmission                during
   network failure, and a visual interface has                severity
   mapping, heatmaps and response tracking                for real-time
   monitoring and reporting.

   NOVELTY - The system has a data integration component

   continuous updating of                aggregated data. An audience

   digital twin                technology to create dynamic virtual
   personas                representing individual audience units. A
   reporting                component (111) with Natural Language
   Generation                (NLG) capabilities that automate creation of  
   comprehensive, narrative-style report. A security                and
   compliance component (112) that ensures ethical                data
   usage, privacy compliance, and robust security                measures
   by implementing end-to-end encryption for                data at rest
   and in transit, role-based access                control (RBAC)
   mechanisms, employing data                anonymization techniques, and
   ensuring compliance                with data protection regulation.

   integrating advanced media monitoring, real-time                audience

   delivering a more robust and                intelligent PR platform. The

   decision-making. The system                ensures broad and targeted

   credibility, leading to greater audience                engagement and
   expanded reach without the need for                extensive manual
   effort by leveraging AI to                identify and engage
   influencers. The NextGenPR's                System Architecture ensures
   that each module                operates independently yet cohesively,
   allowing for                easy updates and maintenance without
   disrupting the                entire system. The method enhances
   operational                efficiency, reduces technical challenges, and
   provides a seamless user experience, allowing the                system
   to grow with organizational needs. The                method effectively
   addresses key PR challenges by                providing enhanced data
   integration, dynamic                audience modeling, personalized
   content generation,                proactive crisis management,
   automated reporting,                efficient influencer engagement,
   robust security,                comprehensive media monitoring, scalable
   architecture, and ethical AI practices. The                architecture
   supports the system's ability to                handle large volumes of
   data and complex processing                tasks while maintaining
   reliability and                performance.

TI A hybrid approach for smart city air quality monitoring using q-rung
   orthopair fuzzy fairly aggregation with Z-numbers
SO AIN SHAMS ENGINEERING JOURNAL
VL 16
IS 8
AR 103492
DI 10.1016/j.asej.2025.103492
EA MAY 2025
DT Article
PD AUG 2025
PY 2025
AB This study presents a novel approach for enhancing air quality
   monitoring (AQM) in smart cities by employing q-rung orthopair fuzzy
   Z-numbers (q-ROFZNs) within a robust multi-criteria decision-making
   framework. The proposed methodology addresses the challenges of
   uncertainty and imprecision in environmental data through the
   integration of q-ROFFZN aggregation operators. In particular, we develop
   and apply the aggregated operation weighted averaging and ordered
   weighted averaging operators under the proposed set, enabling more
   flexible and accurate data fusion. By leveraging Grey Relational
   Analysis (GRA), the model demonstrates superior assessment accuracy and
   resilience compared to existing techniques. The hybrid computational
   strategy effectively supports dynamic decision-making by incorporating
   real-time traffic and industrial data, leading to optimized
   environmental control and public health protection. The findings
   highlight the potential of advanced fuzzy set theories in developing
   sustainable and intelligent solutions for urban air pollution
   management.
RI Shrahili, Mansour/ACW-9444-2022; Ali, Shahbaz/AFQ-8115-2022
OI Shrahili, Mansour/0000-0003-3456-8393; Ali, Shahbaz/0000-0002-5998-0053

EI 2090-4495

UT WOS:001502099100003

PT J
AU Kong, Fanchen
   Du, Liubao
TI Achieving supply chain resilience: market orientation vs technological
   orientation
SO INDUSTRIAL MANAGEMENT & DATA SYSTEMS
DI 10.1108/IMDS-01-2025-0017
EA MAY 2025
DT Article; Early Access
PY 2025
AB PurposeDisruptive events underscore the importance of building supply
   chain resilience (SCR). While existing studies have explored the impact
   of various strategic orientations, particularly market orientation (MO)
   and technological orientation (TO), their interaction remains
   underexplored. This study, grounded in matching theory and dynamic
   capabilities theory, examines how different configurations of MO and TO
   (alignment and misalignment) influence SCR, with artificial intelligence
   (AI) acting as a moderating factor.Design/methodology/approachThis study
   uses a quantitative approach based on data from 250 Chinese firms.
   Polynomial regression and response surface analysis are employed to
   examine the relationships between MO, TO, their alignment and SCR. AI's
   moderating role is also assessed in the context of SCR.FindingsThis
   study finds that MO-TO alignment significantly enhances SCR, with a
   "high MO-high TO" configuration yielding the strongest resilience.
   Misaligned configurations, especially those favoring MO over TO,
   negatively impact SCR, although to a lesser degree. Furthermore, AI
   amplifies the positive effect of MO-TO alignment on SCR by enhancing
   data integration and real-time decision-making
   capabilities.Originality/valueWhile existing research has focused on the
   independent effects of MO and TO, this study adopts a matching
   perspective to explore how different MO-TO configurations influence SCR.
   This research not only enriches the understanding of SCR antecedents but
   also provides new strategic insights for firms to adapt to disruptive
   events. Additionally, it highlights AI's moderating role in enhancing
   SCR through MO-TO alignment, underscoring the importance of AI adoption
   in today's dynamic environment.
RI Kong, Fanchen/ONI-8552-2025
OI Kong, Fanchen/0009-0003-1022-4390
ZR 0
Z8 0
ZB 0
ZS 0
TC 0
ZA 0
Z9 0
U1 17
U2 33
SN 0263-5577
EI 1758-5783

   decision                support are provided for the medical staff.

TI Real-Time Automated Monitoring Architecture for Ensuring Quality ETL
   Processes in Healthcare Data: A Case Study from Cologne University
   Hospital's Medical Data Integration Center.
SO Studies in health technology and informatics
VL 327
BP 193
EP 197
DI 10.3233/SHTI250300
DT Journal Article
PD 2025-May-15
PY 2025
AB This case study discusses the effectiveness of implementing a real-time
   automated monitoring architecture using the ELK Stack (Elasticsearch,
   Logstash and Kibana) to ensure data ingestion quality within the Medical
   Data Integration Center (MeDIC) at the University Hospital Cologne. By
   streamlining the ETL (Extract, Transform, and Load) log analysis
   process, this system minimizes the need for manual effort and brings
   increased efficiency and precision in analyzing data quality issues in
   real-time, detecting errors and potential problems, including the
   ability to uncover new errors. Over a six-month period, the implemented
   dashboard was able to process the ingestion logs of millions of files to
   provide valuable insights for the stakeholders in the decision-making
   process.

TI Ice thickness prediction system based on            multimodal sensor
   data fusion, has artificial            intelligence (AI)-assisted
   decision-making module that            feeds intelligent decision
   suggestions back to users            and edge computing units to
   optimize prediction model            and decision-making process
PN CN119989251-A
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system has an AI-assisted decision-making               
   module that is internally provided with model                training
   and optimization module, decision                generation module, and
   knowledge base management                and update module. A sensor
   calibration module                performs real-time calibration of
   sensor data                through automatic calibration algorithm and  
   feedback control system to ensure data accuracy.                The edge
   computing unit uses deep learning model                and time series
   prediction model to perform                preliminary ice thickness
   predictions. The edge                computing unit uploads the
   processed data and                prediction results to cloud analysis
   and management                platform. The AI-assisted decision-making
   module                receives preprocessed data, generates intelligent 
   decision suggestions through internal model                training and
   optimization submodule, decision                generation submodule,
   and knowledge base management                and update submodule, and
   feeds these suggestions                back to users and edge computing
   units to optimize                the prediction model and
   decision-making                process.
   USE - Ice thickness prediction system based on                multimodal
   sensor data fusion.
   ADVANTAGE - The system achieves multi-dimensional and               
   all-round monitoring of ice thickness by                integrating
   multiple types of sensors, such as                microwave sensors,
   ultrasonic sensors, and infrared                thermal imaging sensors.
   This multimodal data                fusion strategy effectively
   overcomes the                limitations of a single sensor in complex  
   environments and improves the comprehensiveness and               
   accuracy of data collection. The application of the               
   adaptive sensor calibration module uses advanced               
   technologies such as the Kalman filter algorithm to               
   calibrate sensor data in real time, thus                significantly
   reducing measurement errors and noise                interference. The
   system optimizes prediction model                by intelligently
   analyzing and processing the fused                data through deep
   learning algorithms and time                series prediction models,
   thus improving the                accuracy and reliability of ice
   thickness                prediction, and providing reliable data support
   for                applications such as ice navigation and marine       
   engineering, which helps reduce safety risks and               
   operating costs.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for an ice      
   thickness prediction method based on multimodal                sensor
   data fusion.
   DESCRIPTION Of DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a block diagram of the    
   overall system of the ice thickness prediction                system
   based on multimodal sensor data fusion.                (Drawing includes
   non-English language text)

AU Karim, Abdul
   Ryu, Semin
   Jeong, In cheol
TI Deep Learning-Enhanced Spectrogram Analysis for Anatomical Region
   Classification in Biomedical Signals
SO APPLIED SCIENCES-BASEL
VL 15
IS 10
AR 5313
DI 10.3390/app15105313
DT Article
PD MAY 9 2025
PY 2025
AB Accurate classification of biomedical signals is essential for advancing
   non-invasive diagnostic techniques and improving clinical
   decision-making. This study introduces a deep learning-augmented
   spectrogram analysis framework for classifying biomedical signals into
   eight anatomically distinct regions, thereby addressing a significant
   deficiency in automated signal interpretation. The proposed approach
   leverages a fine-tuned ResNet50 model, pre-trained on ImageNet, and
   adapted for a single-channel spectrogram input to ensure robust feature
   extraction and high classification accuracy. Spectrograms derived from
   palpation and percussion signals were preprocessed into grayscale images
   and optimized through data augmentation and hyperparameter tuning to
   enhance the model's generalization. The experimental results demonstrate
   a classification accuracy of 93.37%, surpassing that of conventional
   methods and highlighting the effectiveness of deep learning in
   biomedical signal processing. This study bridges the gap between machine
   learning and clinical applications, enabling an interpretable and
   region-specific classification system that enhances diagnostic
   precision. Future work will explore cross-domain generalization,
   multi-modal medical data integration, and real-time deployment for
   clinical applications. The findings establish a significant advancement
   in non-invasive diagnostics, demonstrating the potential of deep
   learning to refine and automate biomedical signal analysis in clinical
   practice.
RI Jeong, In cheol/; Karim, Abdul/AAE-1317-2022; Ryu, Semin/
OI Jeong, In cheol/0000-0001-9314-5601; Karim, Abdul/0000-0003-2190-7210;
   Ryu, Semin/0000-0002-4183-0014

U2 6
EI 2076-3417

   data through a sensor network deployed in a smart                space.
   Feature extraction is performed (S2) on each                modal data
   to generate a feature representation of                each modal data.
   An adaptive gating weighting                mechanism is used (S3) to
   fuse the feature                representations of each modal data to
   generate a                fused feature representation. The fused
   feature                representation is converted (S4) into a
   lightweight                feature through a lightweight deep learning
   model                pre-deployed on an edge device in the smart space. 
   The lightweight feature is uploaded (S5) to the                cloud.
   High-level feature fusion is performed on                the lightweight
   feature through the adaptive deep                learning model
   pre-deployed on the cloud, and a                high-level fused feature
   representation is                obtained. A decision result is
   generated (S6) based                on the high-level fused feature     
             representation.

   Things (AIoT) multimodal data fusion decision                method used
   in smart space construction of smart                city, smart home,
   industrial internet of                things.
   ADVANTAGE - The method which improves the capabilities of               
   multimodal data fusion technology in feature                extraction,
   cross-modal correlation mining and                real-time processing
   at the edge, and meets the                needs of smart space for
   efficient fusion of                multimodal data and low-latency
   dynamic                decision-making.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a deep      
   learning-based AIoT multimodal data fusion               
   decision-making system.

   NOVELTY - The system (100) has an adaptive data fusion

   module (106a) that assigns                sensor-specific confidence
   scores based on                real-time performance metrics, including
   signal                stability, environmental factors, and historical  
   reliability. The adaptive data fusion engine is                composed
   of an uncertainty quantification module                (106b) that
   detects anomalies, compensates for                missing data, and
   adjusts fusion parameters using                probabilistic inference
   techniques, and a                reinforcement learning-based
   optimization module                (106c) that iteratively refines
   fusion strategies                based on feedback from predictive

   reliability and effectiveness of predictive                analytics in

   continuously adapting to variations in sensor                performance
