TI Enhancing human and animal health data integration and informed actions
   for pandemic preparedness at the primary healthcare level: a
   multisectoral conceptual framework
SO JOURNAL OF GLOBAL HEALTH
VL 15
AR 03018
DI 10.7189/jogh.15.03018
DT Editorial Material
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB A key priority for strengthening global health capacity for pandemic
   response is rapid risk assessment for timely, context-specific
   decision-making. However, integrating human and animal health data for
   preparedness remains a challenge, especially at the primary healthcare
   (PHC) level. Here we review Vietnam's pandemic response and propose a
   conceptual framework for improving data integration across sectors in
   low-and middle-income countries. Despite the country's progress in
   health information systems and telehealth, disparities in data use and
   coordination between human and animal health sectors hindered effective
   responses. Existing mechanisms between healthcare and veterinary
   professionals lack integrated data-sharing, delaying risk communication
   and crisis management, particularly in rural areas with limited IT
   access and infrastructure. The proposed model includes five components:
   data interoperability with standardised indicators for real-time
   synthesis; robust digital health infrastructure and telehealth
   expansion; capacity building in data management for health and
   veterinary professionals; epidemic intelligence tools for risk
   assessment; and evidence-driven decision-making for coordinated epidemic
   responses. This model offers a pathway to strengthen health systems and
   improve pandemic preparedness at the PHC level in Vietnam and similar
   settings.
RI Cao Nguyen, Duy/; Tran, Bach/HCH-3137-2022; Tang, Shenglan/LYO-7161-2024

AU Verdejo, Dominique
   Laurent, Eunika Mercier
BE Verdejo, D
   Mercier-Laurent, E
TI How Can LLM Improve Efficiency of C4ISR?
SO ARTIFICIAL INTELLIGENCE FOR GLOBAL SECURITY, AI4GS 2024
SE IFIP Advances in Information and Communication Technology
VL 743
BP 1
EP 17
DI 10.1007/978-3-031-96522-7_1
DT Proceedings Paper
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB The effective Command, Control, Communications, Computers, Intelligence,
   Surveillance, and Reconnaissance (C4ISR) systems are crucial for modern
   military operations providing clear situational awareness and vital
   elements for decision-making. Various AI techniques have been already
   applied to enhance data integration and some other C4ISR components.
   This article proposes to explore the potential of Large Language Models
   (LLMs) to enhance the current C4ISR capacities such as analyzing vast
   amounts of data, translating languages, and generating diverse creative
   text formats that make them useful for heterogeneous data and
   information fusion, threats and fakes detection and analysis and
   decision support. After the introduction, the literature review
   discusses the technical considerations and potential benefits from the
   integration of LLMs into C4ISR systems. This discussion includes the
   functionalities such as multisource and multimodal data integration,
   detection, analysis and prediction of threats and misinformation,
   decision support through analysis of complex scenarios, identifying
   potential courses of action, and providing real-time recommendations to
   commanders working in evolving situations.
   The main challenges related to the use of today's LLMs to enhance C4ISR
   framework such as data security, model interpretability, and bias
   mitigation will be studied during this research. The specific challenges
   will be derived from the main case study. This article includes also
   some characteristics that may serve to elaborate the best-suited
   framework. This article ends by perspective for future work.
CT 1st International Conference on Artificial Intelligence for Global
   Security-AI4GS

CL FRANCE

TI Automated Data Generation Method for Power System Online Security
   Assessment Based on Multi-Source Heterogeneous Information Fusion
SO 2025 10TH ASIA CONFERENCE ON POWER AND ELECTRICAL ENGINEERING, ACPEE
SE 5th Asia Conference on Power and Electrical Engineering
BP 1821
EP 1826
DI 10.1109/ACPEE64358.2025.11041384
DT Proceedings Paper
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB To improve the efficiency and quality of power system online security
   analysis data generation, an innovative solution based on intelligent
   fusion of multi-source heterogeneous information is proposed. The
   approach integrates real-time online and offline mode data to construct
   a data fusion model tailored for online analysis of power systems. The
   multi-source data fusion method includes key modules such as data
   parsing and verification, power grid topology analysis, model extension
   and parameter fusion. Building on the aforementioned theoretical
   methodology, a new-generation power grid parallel computing platform
   based on dynamic load balancing technology has been developed. This
   platform employs a distributed computing architecture, integrates the
   power system analysis software package (PSASP) computing engine, and
   supports real-time simulation and analysis of large-scale power systems.
   Currently, this system has been successfully deployed in multiple
   provincial dispatch centers of the State Grid Corporation of China,
   providing reliable technical support for online security assessment and
   intelligent dispatch decision-making in large-scale power grids.

GP ASME
TI A PIPELINE LEAKAGE IDENTIFICATION METHOD BASED ON IMPROVED SELFATTENTION
   MECHANISM BY HIGH-LOW FREQUENCY DIFFERENTIAL
SO PROCEEDINGS OF ASME 2025 PRESSURE VESSELS & PIPING CONFERENCE, PVP2025,
   VOL 6
DT Proceedings Paper
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB Oil pipelines are one of the most important modes of modern energy
   transportation, and due to many factors, such as deterioration, aging,
   natural disasters and third-party sabotage in the operation of
   pipelines, leakage accidents and other potential safety hazards are
   frequent, posing a serious threat to the safety of the energy supply
   system. In order to meet this challenge, wireless sensor networks are
   often used to implement online and real-time monitoring of oil
   pipelines, which can compensate for the shortcomings of low efficiency
   of manual inspection and the lack of accuracy of existing leak diagnosis
   technologies in terms of small leaks and multi-source leaks. However,
   factors such as measurement noise interference, differences in sensor
   types, limitations in the number of network nodes, and monitoring
   location layout will lead to the problems of diverse forms, large
   quantities, and complex relationships of the collected detection
   information. In order to ensure that the type of pipeline leakage can be
   accurately judged in a timely manner, the information fusion method
   should be adjusted to achieve the functions of signal noise reduction,
   multi-sensor information fusion and complementarity, and joint
   decisionmaking of multi-sensor identification results [ 1]. In this
   paper, we propose a method for improving the identification of pipe
   leakage types using High and Low Frequency Difference (HLFD) to improve
   the self-attention mechanism driven Long Short-Term Memory Network
   (LSTM) for multi-source data. Based on the structural characteristics of
   the pipeline leakage monitoring network system and the in-depth analysis
   of the characteristics of the detection data, this paper constructs a
   neural network model based on the HLFD method of selfattention driven
   LSTM, which uses the feature-level multi-source data fusion method. In
   the initial stage of data processing, we use wavelet transform
   technology to pre-process the leakage signal and extract key data
   features. Subsequently, at the feature processing level, we use the
   improved self-attention-driven LSTM model to comprehensively analyze the
   preliminary recognition results from multiple nodes to achieve more
   accurate joint decision-making. Firstly, the high-dimensional feature
   vectors were constructed by extracting the features of the pressure data
   under different working conditions. Subsequently, the self-attention
   driven LSTM model was used to train the pressure change data. Finally,
   the abnormal pressure data and flow data identified by classification
   are used to identify the specific working conditions, so as to realize
   the leakage alarm function. This method not only improves the accuracy
   of pipeline leakage identification, but also provides effective support
   for timely response to potential leakage risks.
CT 2025 Pressure Vessels and Piping Conference-PVP
CY JUL 20-25, 2025
CL Montreal, CANADA
SP The American Society of Mechanical Engineers; American Society of
   Mechanical Engineers Pressure Vessels and Piping Division

TI Electrochemical energy storage power stations decision-making via
   digital twins and simulation-based data fusion
SO INTERNATIONAL JOURNAL OF COMPUTER APPLICATIONS IN TECHNOLOGY
VL 76
IS 3-4
DI 10.1504/IJCAT.2025.149360
DT Article
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB The digital twin model for power stations utilises a dynamic
   three-dimensional representation to map the physical system and
   real-time data, encompassing monitoring control, state evolution,
   analysis, evaluation and integrating real-time operational laws, power
   station analysis and inference logic. This enables real-time monitoring,
   operational management, intelligent analysis, virtual inspection and
   simulation training. Moreover, the joint Kalman Filter is employed for
   data fusion to enhance the fusion effect of heterogeneous data from
   multiple sources within the digital twin-based electrochemical energy
   storage power station. Simulation results demonstrate promising
   performance in terms of fusion error and efficiency. By leveraging
   accurate data fusion, the proposed data-driven digital twin for
   electrochemical energy storage power stations offers several benefits,
   including improved accuracy, operational efficiency, proactive
   maintenance, real-time monitoring, enhanced system reliability and
   safety. These advantages significantly contribute to optimising the data
   fusion process in electrochemical energy storage power stations,
   ultimately leading to enhanced performance and decision-making.

TI Development of a Mobile-Based Gaze-Tracker for Enhanced Survey
   Responses: Integrating Eye Gaze as a Weight Factor in Answer Evaluation
SO COMPUTATIONAL SCIENCE AND COMPUTATIONAL INTELLIGENCE, CSCI 2024, PT XI
SE Communications in Computer and Information Science
VL 2511
BP 3
EP 14
DI 10.1007/978-3-031-94962-3_1
DT Proceedings Paper
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB With the increasing reliance on digital surveys for data collection,
   ensuring the accuracy and validity of responses is becoming more
   critical. Traditional surveys, relying on static choice options, often
   fail to capture individuals' full intentions or reveal insights in their
   decisionmaking process. For instance, when an individual hesitates
   between two possible answers but must choose only one, such information
   is not visible in surveys. For this reason, the following paper
   introduces a novel mobile gaze-tracking application designed to enhance
   survey data quality by incorporating eye gaze data as a weighting factor
   to uncover subconscious decision-making processes. Our approach utilizes
   the front camera of mobile devices to dynamically track eye movements,
   adjusting the weight of responses accordingly. This real-time gaze
   tracking, enabled without additional hardware and compatible with mobile
   systems, is both accessible and cost-effective, making it feasible for
   widespread use in various research contexts. By integrating gaze data,
   our method provides a richer and more comprehensive understanding of
   decision-making processes in surveys, reducing biases inherent in
   self-reported data.
CT 11th International Conference on Computational Science and Computational
   Intelligence-CSCI
CY DEC 11-13, 2024
CL Las Vegas, NV

TI AI-Driven Learning Analytics for Applied Behavior Analysis Therapy
SO IEEE TRANSACTIONS ON LEARNING TECHNOLOGIES
VL 18
BP 1097
EP 1111
DI 10.1109/TLT.2025.3637864
DT Article
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB Applied behavior analysis (ABA) therapy is a widely used intervention
   for students with special education needs (SENs), particularly those
   with autism spectrum disorder and co-occurring intellectual
   disabilities. However, despite its proven effectiveness, the integration
   of artificial intelligence (AI) and learning analytics (LA) in ABA
   therapy remains largely underexplored. This study examines the impact of
   an AI-driven LA system on prediction performance, intervention
   effectiveness for SEN students, and support for therapists and teachers.
   The system collects and analyzes physiological, environmental, and
   behavioral data in real time to generate personalized intervention
   recommendations. A total of 33 students and 26 therapists/teachers from
   special schools and therapy centers in Hong Kong participated in an
   eight-week ABA intervention, followed by a postevaluation session. The
   study assessed predictive accuracy, student learning outcomes, and
   educator perceptions using empirical data and qualitative feedback.
   Results indicate that the system achieved a predictive accuracy of
   88.83% and a precision of 86.64% in forecasting learning outcomes, with
   statistically significant student performance improvement (medium effect
   size). Educators reported that the system's AI-driven recommendations
   enhanced their ability to develop individualized student profiles and
   intervention strategies. While the system did not replace traditional
   ABA methodologies, it improved decision making by providing actionable
   insights through multimodal data integration. As of today, our system
   has been used by over 1000 students with SENs in Hong Kong, Singapore,
   and Canada, demonstrating the real-world impact of AI-driven LA.

TI Design of Intelligent Decision-Making Model for Big Data Analysis
SO 2025 INTERNATIONAL CONFERENCE ON INTELLIGENT COMPUTING AND KNOWLEDGE
   EXTRACTION, ICICKE
AR 1654
DI 10.1109/ICICKE65317.2025.11136215
DT Proceedings Paper
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB The existing decision-making system has problems such as low efficiency
   of multi-source heterogeneous data fusion and insufficient real-time
   decision-making accuracy. This paper improves the performance of the
   decision model by constructing a hybrid framework of fusion data
   preprocessing, ensemble learning and deep reinforcement learning. First,
   the distributed data cleaning technology based on MapReduce is used to
   process TB-level industrial sensor data to remove outliers and redundant
   information. Then, a dual-channel feature extraction structure is
   designed on the e-commerce user behavior dataset to compress the feature
   representation dimension to 23% of the original data. Subsequently, an
   improved deep deterministic policy gradient algorithm is introduced to
   optimize the decision strategy through a dynamic reward function, and a
   fraud recognition accuracy rate of 92.5% is achieved in a financial risk
   control simulation experiment. The online decision-making system finally
   deployed can process an average of 15,628 real-time data per second in
   the logistics scheduling scenario, and the average decision delay is
   controlled at 46.5ms, which verifies that the model improves data
   processing efficiency in complex scenarios and provides a scalable
   technical framework for cross-domain intelligent decision-making
   systems.

TI Uncovering the black box of medical image analysis algorithms: recent
   advances in explainable artificial intelligence in medical image
   analysis
SO CHINESE SCIENCE BULLETIN-CHINESE
VL 70
IS 33
BP 5675
EP 5695
DI 10.1360/TB-2024-1299
DT Article
PD 2025
PY 2025
AB Artificial intelligence (AI) has evolved significantly since its
   inception in the mid-20th century. With the advent of powerful
   computational resources and the accumulation of large-scale datasets in
   the 21st century, deep learning has achieved groundbreaking
   advancements, leading to the development of models such as convolutional
   neural networks (CNNs), recurrent neural networks (RNNs),
   attention-based models, and diffusion models. One of the most
   transformative applications of AI is in medical imaging, where AI-driven
   techniques have significantly enhanced disease screening, diagnosis,
   treatment planning, and prognosis evaluation. Despite these
   advancements, AI models often function as "black boxes", making them
   difficult to explain, thereby hindering their clinical adoption. The
   lack of transparency in AI-driven decision-making reduces trust among
   healthcare professionals, posing a critical barrier to widespread
   clinical implementation. To address this challenge, explainable AI (XAI)
   has emerged as a crucial research domain aimed at enhancing model
   explainability and trustworthiness. XAI techniques can be categorized
   based on explanation type (intrinsic vs. post-hoc), explanation
   specificity (model-specific vs. model-agnostic), and explanation scope
   (global vs. local). Intrinsic explainability is inherent in simpler
   models such as linear regression and decision trees, whereas post-hoc
   explainability is required for complex deep learning models.
   Model-specific explainability is tailored for particular architectures,
   while model-agnostic approaches, such as SHapley Additive exPlanations
   (SHAP) and local interpretable model-agnostic explanations (LIME), can
   be applied across different models. Global explanations provide insights
   into overall model behavior, whereas local explanations focus on
   individual predictions. Several XAI methods have been integrated into
   medical imaging analysis to enhance explainability. Feature attribution
   methods, such as deep learning important features (DeepLIFT) and
   occlusion sensitivity analysis, highlight critical regions in medical
   images that influence AI predictions. Saliency-based methods, including
   class activation mapping (CAM) and its extensions (Grad-CAM, Grad-CAM++,
   Score-CAM), visualize model attention in CNNs. Attention mechanisms,
   widely utilized in transformer-based architectures, provide enhanced
   feature weighting, improving model explainability. Prototype-based
   explanations identify representative cases within a dataset to
   facilitate human comprehension of AI decisions, while counterfactual
   explanations explore alternative scenarios to reveal causal
   relationships. Despite the progress in XAI research, several challenges
   remain. First, explanation quality varies across techniques, with some
   methods generating unreliable or inconsistent explanation. Second,
   computational costs associated with perturbation-based and
   sampling-intensive methods limit their real-time applicability. Third, a
   trade-off often exists between model accuracy and explainability,
   necessitating innovative solutions to balance both aspects. Finally,
   integrating XAI techniques into clinical workflows requires robust
   evaluation metrics that align with human-centered decision-making
   processes. Future research should focus on optimizing XAI algorithms for
   medical applications by reducing computational overhead, improving
   causal inference, and enhancing multimodal data integration to
   facilitate transparent and trustworthy AI-driven healthcare solutions.

   Zhang, Li
   Fu, Dianxuan
   Qiu, Qizhi
   Chen, Yuli
   Yi, Lilin
   Hu, Weisheng
TI Theories and Technologies of Intelligent Digital Twin Modeling for
   Optical Networks (Invited)
SO ACTA OPTICA SINICA
VL 45
IS 13
AR 1306007
DI 10.3788/AOS251007
DT Article
PD JAN 2025
PY 2025
AB Significance Digital twin technology has emerged as a transformative
   approach to bridging the gap between the physical and digital worlds,
   enabling unprecedented levels of intelligence, automation, and
   optimization in complex systems. In the context of optical communication
   networks, the rapid growth of data traffic driven by new applications
   such as Internet of Things (IoT), artificial intelligence (AI), cloud
   computing, and ultra-high-definition video imposes stringent
   requirements on network capacity, latency, reliability, and flexibility.
   Traditional optical networks, while benefiting from advances in coherent
   transmission, elastic optical networks, and software-defined networking,
   still face challenges such as conservative link configurations, static
   control mechanisms, and resource over-provisioning during fault
   recovery. These limitations hinder the efficient utilization of spectrum
   resources and the realization of intelligent, dynamic network
   management. Digital twin technology offers a solution by enabling
   real-time, high-fidelity mapping of the physical network into a digital
   word, supporting accurate perception, prediction, and intelligent
   decision-making throughout the entire network lifecycle. This paradigm
   shift is essential for evolving from passive maintenance to proactive,
   autonomous operation in next-generation optical networks. Progress
   Significant advances have been made in the development of digital twin
   technologies for intelligent optical networks, particularly in two core
   areas: high-precision physical-layer modeling and data-driven
   self-learning. For physical-layer modeling, a modular approach is widely
   adopted, where each network element-such as fibers, erbium-doped fiber
   amplifiers (EDFAs), Raman amplifiers (RAs), and wavelength selective
   switches (WSSs)-is independently modeled and then integrated to
   construct an end-to-end digital representation of the optical link (Fig.
   1). Traditional white-box models are based on physical principles. For
   instance, the Manakov equation and the Gaussian noise (GN) model can be
   utilized to model fiber nonlinearity. Ordinary differential equations
   (ODEs) can be used to model EDFAs and RAs. Though these white-box models
   provide strong interpretability, they are often constrained by
   computational complexity and idealized assumptions. To overcome the
   limitations of white-box models, black-box models leveraging machine
   learning techniques such as neural networks have been introduced,
   achieving high prediction accuracy and computational efficiency while
   closely matching the results of conventional simulations (Figs. 3 and
   7). Furthermore, grey-box models that combine physical knowledge with
   data-driven learning have demonstrated improved accuracy, robustness,
   and generalizability by integrating the strengths of both white-box and
   black-box approaches. This modeling paradigm has been successfully
   applied to the characterization of fibers, EDFAs, and RAs, where
   advanced machine learning methods such as active learning significantly
   reduce the required training data without sacrificing accuracy (Figs. 5,
   8, and 9). Similar strategies have been extended to the modeling of
   filtering penalty, further enhancing the accuracy of optical network
   digital twins. After developing accurate physical models, data-driven
   self-learning becomes an essential technique for the deployment and
   continuous evolution of these models. This approach enables digital
   twins to autonomously adapt to dynamic network environments and maintain
   high modeling accuracy over time.
   The self-learning process primarily involves three key research aspects:
   telemetry, model inaccuracy correction, and input parameter uncertainty
   refinement. First, telemetry-driven data acquisition focuses on the
   real-time collection and integration of multi-source data from both the
   optical and digital domains. In addition to deploying devices such as
   optical power meters within optical links for monitoring purposes,
   acquiring real-time data from the digital signal processor (DSP) at the
   receiver has become a crucial approach. This method enables the
   real-time perception of multiple key metrics, including optical power
   evolution, nonlinear interference (Fig. 10), and filtering impairments
   (Fig. 11), thus providing a solid data foundation for the effective
   operation of subsequent self-learning algorithms. Second, in terms of
   model inaccuracy correction, techniques such as transfer learning and
   active learning have demonstrated the ability to significantly enhance
   the generalization and adaptability of models in real-world scenarios.
   Characterized by small sample sizes, the data dependency and training
   costs associated with large-scale deployment of digital twin systems can
   be reduced (Figs. 12 and 13). Third, input parameter refinement
   techniques further formulate the uncertainty in input parameters as an
   optimization problem. By applying suitable optimization algorithms and
   various refining paradigms, uncertainties in the input parameters can be
   reduced, thereby reducing the impact of measurement noise and incomplete
   information on model performance (Figs. 14 and 15). Conclusions and
   Prospects Digital twin technology is revolutionizing the management and
   optimization of optical communication networks by providing a dynamic,
   high-fidelity virtual representation of the physical infrastructure. The
   combination of physical-layer modeling and data-driven self-learning
   significantly enhances the accuracy, adaptability, and intelligence of
   network operations. Future research will focus on improving model
   scalability, data ecosystem integration, and trustworthiness. Challenges
   such as data sparsity, cross-domain generalization, and real-time
   deployment have yet to be solved. In the future, addressing these
   challenges through joint efforts among academia, industry, and research
   organizations will be essential for realizing the paradigm shift from
   passive maintenance to proactive prediction in optical network
   operations, thereby laying a solid foundation for the next generation of
   intelligent communication infrastructure.
RI Qiu, Qizhi/PHE-6884-2026

TI Three-dimensional model and field data            fusion-based
   construction progress detection system for            use in technical
   field of electric network building            engineering, has detection
   module comparing panoramic            image of site with model,
   automatically detecting            construction progress and generating
   report
PN CN119206123-A; CN119206123-B
AE JIANGSU XINGHU TECHNOLOGY CO LTD
AB 
   NOVELTY - The detection system has a data collecting               
   module for collecting point cloud data and a                panoramic
   image of an iron tower construction site                through a laser
   radar and panoramic camera carried                by an unmanned aerial
   vehicle and transmitting the                point cloud data and a
   panoramic image to a cloud                storage and processing
   platform in real-time                through a fifth-generation (5G)
   module. A data                pre-processing module performs
   pre-processing                operations of de-noising, filtering and
   semantic                segmentation to the point cloud data and
   corrects                and splices the panoramic image. A progress     
   detection module compares the panoramic image of                the
   construction site collected in real-time with a               
   three-dimensional fusion model in a frame-by-frame               
   manner, automatically detects a construction                progress and
   generates a construction progress                detection result and a
   construction progress                report. A feedback module feedbacks
   the report to a                construction management platform in
   real-time for a                construction manager to decide.
   USE - Three-dimensional model and field data                fusion-based
   construction progress detection system                for use in a
   technical field of electric network                building engineering.
   ADVANTAGE - The progress detection module compares the               
   panoramic image of the construction site collected                in
   real-time with the three-dimensional fusion                model in a
   frame-by-frame manner and automatically                detects the
   construction progress so as to realize                efficient
   collection process of construction site                data. The
   detection system realizes precision                processing and
   real-time monitoring operations to                improve efficiency and
   decision-making ability of                construction management
   through automatic progress                detection and real-time
   feedback.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The data pre-processing module performs global   
   semantic classification process using a PointNet++                (RTM:
   Deep Hierarchical Feature Learning on Point                Sets in a
   Metric Space).INDEPENDENT CLAIMS are included for:(1) a detection method
   of a three-dimensional                model and field data fusion-based
   construction                progress detection system; and(2) a
   computer-readable storage medium storing                a computer

   distributed energy                resource is generated according to the
   data and the                natural language description. The results of

   are identified and corrected.                The model is received by

   checking and                modifying. The proper algorithm is applied

   algorithm utilizes attribute matrix                analysis and pattern
   recognition techniques to map                native attributes to a
   predefined canonical data                model. Transformed data is
   stored in a data mesh                serving as a central repository.
   Actionable                insights are generated based on predictive    
   analytics models. Quotes are generated utilizing a                sales

   stored transformed data. The stored data                is archived in a

   additions in                vendor-specific data. A vendor onboarding

TI System for detecting Parkinson disease using CNN            model that
   processes diverse image data to identify            early-stage
   biomarkers of disease, has multi-modal            image data
   integration, in which modalities, including            handwriting or
   drawing images, video frames and facial            expression analysis
   are incorporated
PN IN202441093181-A
AE SHRI VISHNU ENG COLLEGE WOMEN
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system comprises multi-modal image data               
   integration, in which diverse image modalities,                including
   handwriting or drawing images, video                frames, and facial
   expression analysis are                incorporated. The model leverages
   transfer learning                from pre-trained CNNs, such as ResNet
   (Residual                Network) or VGG (Vanishing Gradient Problem) to
   fine-tune the model for Parkinson disease                detection. The
   explainable AI (XAI) features, such                as GradCAM heatmaps
   are incorporated. The computer                vision techniques are
   uniquely combined for                analyzing facial expressions, such
   as detecting                hypomimia, with gait analysis to identify
   symptoms                of Parkinson disease. The system is designed to 
   work within clinical workflows, providing automated               
   diagnostics that can be integrated into existing               
   Electronic Health Record (EHR) systems. The system                is
   adapted for longitudinal studies, analyzing                sequential
   images from the same patient to track                the progression of
   Parkinson disease
   USE - System for detecting Parkinson disease using a               
   Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) model that                processes
   diverse image data to identify                early-stage biomarkers of
   the disease.
   ADVANTAGE - By analyzing not only brain scans but also               
   non-invasive indicators like gait analysis and                motor
   function, the system provides a holistic and                more
   accurate detection of Parkinson disease,                especially in
   the early stages when motor symptoms                are more subtle. The
   system, powered by CNNs, is                designed to spot early
   biomarkers of Parkinson                disease in imaging data, enabling
   earlier and                potentially more effective intervention. The
   model                uses CNNs to automatically learn the intricate,    
   subtle features in images that are difficult for               
   clinicians to detect manually, offering a proactive               
   diagnostic tool. The model leverages transfer                learning
   from pre-trained CNNs (such as ResNet or                VGG) to
   fine-tune the model for Parkinson disease                detection. This
   reduces the amount of labeled data                required and enhances
   the model's generalizability.                The system uses
   sophisticated data augmentation                techniques (rotation,
   flipping, scaling, etc.) to                artificially increase the
   dataset's size, improving                model robustness and reducing
   overfitting, which is                critical in medical imaging tasks.
   The tools                highlight the regions of the image that the
   model                focuses on when making a diagnosis, making the     
   decision process more transparent and interpretable                for
   clinicians. The integration of explainability                ensures
   that healthcare providers can trust and                validate the
   system's predictions, addressing a                major barrier in the
   adoption of AI in healthcare.                By analyzing visual data
   from sources like video                clips or patient interactions,
   the model introduces                a non-invasive, real-time assessment
   method, which                is less commonly explored in Parkinson
   disease                diagnosis. The system is designed to work within 
   clinical workflows, providing automated diagnostics                that
   can be integrated into existing Electronic                Health Record
   (EHR) systems. This enables                healthcare providers to
   access AI powered                diagnostic predictions alongside
   traditional                medical data. The integration helps bridge
   the gap                between AI predictions and physician             
   decision-making, allowing the model to act as an               
   assistive tool rather than a replacement,                ultimately
   increasing the likelihood of adoption in                medical
   settings. The system leverages                computational efficiency,
   enabling deployment on                both cloud platforms and edge
   devices. By reducing                the reliance on expensive imaging
   equipment and                processing power, the model opens the door
   to                cost-effective, widespread adoption, especially in    
   resource-limited settings or remote healthcare               
   environments. The design choice ensures that the                model
   could be deployed globally, even in                underserved regions
   with limited access to high-end                medical technologies.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method    
   for detecting Parkinson disease using a                Convolutional
   Neural Network (CNN) model that                processes diverse image
   data to identify                early-stage biomarkers of the disease.
   DESCRIPTION Of DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a block diagram of a
   system                for detecting Parkinson disease.

AU Burayk, Nahlah Salah A. Albari
   Saigh, Renad Abduallah Mohammed
   Almutiri, Megren Bander Ageeb

   Asiri, Mohammed Ali Yahya

   Al Qobaii, Fatimah Jameel
   Almutairi, Ibtisam Hamdan Refaei
   Alanezi, Ahlam Awied
TI Hyperglycemic Crises in Diabetic Patients-Overview, Role of Health
   Informatics and Neurological Findings-Magnetic Resonance
   Neuroimaging-Review Article
SO EGYPTIAN JOURNAL OF CHEMISTRY
VL 67
IS 13
SI SI
BP 925
EP 943
DI 10.21608/ejchem.2024.320857.10430
DT Review
PD DEC 2024
PY 2024
AB Background: Diabetic crises, including diabetic ketoacidosis (DKA) and
   hyperosmolar hyperglycemic state (HHS), are acute, life- threatening
   conditions requiring prompt and effective management. Both conditions
   are associated with significant electrolyte disturbances, including
   hypokalemia, hypophosphatemia, and acidosis, which can lead to severe
   complications if not managed quickly. These complications may cause
   significant damage to the brain. Objective: This study aims to evaluate
   management strategies for electrolyte disturbances and complications
   associated with diabetic crises, focusing on the role of standard and
   advanced diagnostic imaging in assessing brain conditions and examining
   the impact of ketoacidosis brain damage through case studies.
   Additionally, it assesses the role of health informatics and artificial
   intelligence in improving diagnosis and treatment. Methods: A
   comprehensive review was conducted of current clinical guidelines and
   management practices for diabetic ketoacidosis and hyperosmolar
   hyperglycemic state. Data was collected from recent literature on
   electrolyte replacement, bicarbonate therapy, and complications
   associated with diabetic crises. The review also included an analysis of
   the role of health informatics in managing these conditions, with
   emphasis on data integration, decision support systems, and remote
   monitoring. Furthermore, several diagnostic cases were examined using
   MRI and imaging to study the anatomical and functional brain changes in
   patients with ketoacidosis conditions. Results: Effective management of
   diabetic crises requires careful monitoring and electrolyte replacement,
   with potassium and phosphate being critical. Bicarbonate therapy should
   be used selectively due to its potential negative effects. Common
   complications include seizures, organ failure, and brain edema, which
   require vigilant monitoring. Health informatics enhances patient care
   through data management, decision support, and remote monitoring, while
   artificial intelligence techniques show promise in improving diagnostic
   accuracy and efficiency. Conclusion: Comprehensive management of
   diabetic crises involves addressing electrolyte imbalances and
   preventing complications. Data reveals changes in brain structure and
   function in affected individuals, with health informatics and artificial
   intelligence serving as valuable tools that enhance the management and
   outcomes of these critical conditions by facilitating accurate
   diagnosis, real-time monitoring, and data-driven decision-making.
RI Asiri, Mohammed/CAI-9747-2022

U2 1
SN 0449-2285
EI 2357-0245

UT WOS:001377039700006

TI Performance evaluation and optimization of distributed collaborative
   operation and maintenance control platform based on information
   processing
SO INTELLIGENT DECISION TECHNOLOGIES-NETHERLANDS
VL 19
IS 2
BP 1240
EP 1252
DI 10.1177/18724981241291435
EA DEC 2024
DT Article
PD MAR 2025
PY 2025
AB Aiming at the problems of data isolation, poor real-time performance,
   low efficiency, and lack of intelligent cooperation in traditional
   operation and maintenance, this paper proposes a distributed cooperative
   operation and maintenance control platform based on information
   processing. Through the steps of data distributed collection,
   pre-processing, fusion analysis, and dynamic resource allocation, the
   data processing efficiency, system response speed, resource utilization,
   and decision accuracy are significantly improved. The experimental
   results show that compared with the traditional method, the platform
   improves the data processing efficiency to 500GB/hour, the system
   response time to 2 s, the resource utilization rate to 68.75%, and the
   decision accuracy to 90%, which significantly enhances the intelligence
   and real-time of operation and maintenance control.
RI Ma, Jianwei/H-6551-2011

TI Method for predicting financing risk for financial           
   institution, involves collecting multidimensional data            and
   performing optimization by enhanced learning            algorithm to
   generate final risk prediction data for            decision support
PN CN119027244-A
AE JINDONGYUN DIGITAL TECHNOLOGY ZHEJIANG
AB 
   NOVELTY - The method involves collecting the               
   multidimensional data from multiple data sources.                The
   multi-dimensional data is mapped to the                high-dimensional
   space by the non-linear kernel                embedding algorithm. The
   conduction risk data is                generated. The dynamic path
   weight adjustment is                performed on the conduction risk
   data through                adaptive entropy optimization algorithm, and
   the                adjusted conduction risk data through multi-stage    
   feedback loop is optimized to generate feedback               
   optimization data. The feedback optimizing data is                linked
   with the data of the external data source.                The linkage
   optimizing data is generated. The                linkage optimization
   data is inputted into a risk                prediction model. The
   resistance training is                performed by generating a
   confrontation network,                and optimization is performed by
   an enhanced                learning algorithm to generate final risk    
              prediction data for decision support.
   USE - Method for predicting financing risk for                financial
   institution.
   ADVANTAGE - The prediction method can capture the market               
   change in real time through recursive feedback and               
   heterogeneous data fusion mechanism, improve the               
   prediction accuracy and decision support ability,                and is
   suitable for risk management and decision                making of
   financial institution in complex market                environment. The
   mapping process obviously improves                the effect of
   financing risk prediction, especially                when processing
   complex and multidimensional                financial data. Larger the
   value makes the Gaussian                kernel function more sensitive
   to the micro                difference between the data points so as to
   be more                suitable for processing the data with high       
           resolution characteristic.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a system    
    for predicting financing risk for financial                institution.

   with minimal                management effort or interaction with a
   provider of                the service. The cloud computing is defined
   as a                computing capability that provides an abstraction

   architecture, thus allowing a user to                access virtual
   computing resources in the cloud                without regard for

   in robotics, has robotic platform, sensors            including cameras,

   unit
PN IN202441075522-A
AE SENTHILSINGH B; PRABU S I S; DONI R A; FRANKLIN R G; SUJIHELEN L
AB 
   NOVELTY - The integrated multi-sensor fusion system                (100)
   for enhanced perception in robotics has: a                robotic
   platform (102); sensors (104) including                cameras (104a),
   light detection and ranging (LiDAR)                radar (104a),
   ultrasonic sensors (104d), and                inertial measurement units
   (IMUs) (104e)                strategically positioned on the robotic
   platform;                and a sensor fusion processing unit (106). The 
   sensor fusion processing unit has: (i) a data               
   preprocessing unit (106a) configured to standardize                data
   format and correct sensor-specific errors;                (ii) a dynamic
   weight assignment unit (106b)                adjusting weights of sensor
   data based on factors                including sensor accuracy,
   reliability, and                environmental conditions.
   USE - Integrated multi-sensor fusion system for                enhanced
   perception in robotics such as autonomous                vehicles,
   drones, and industrial robots.
   ADVANTAGE - The integrated multi-sensor fusion system has               
   improved accuracy and reliability in environmental               
   perception, adaptability to diverse conditions, and                a
   learning capability that enhances performance                over time.
   The robotics provides a comprehensive                and intelligent
   solution for enhanced perception                through the integration
   of sensors and dynamic                adaptation of the fusion process.
   The real-time                adaptability enhances the system's ability
   to                respond to rapidly changing environmental             
   conditions, ensuring optimal perception and               
   decision-making performance. The multi-sensor                fusion
   positioning module is capable of global                positioning of
   the vehicle body of the compound                robot, and real-time
   control of the motion state of                the vehicle body based on
   dynamic fusion of sensor                data.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - The integrated multi-sensor fusion system        
   (100) for enhanced perception in robotics has: a                robotic
   platform (102); sensors (104) including                cameras (104a),
   light detection and ranging (LiDAR)                radar (104a),
   ultrasonic sensors (104d), and                inertial measurement units
   (IMUs) (104e)                strategically positioned on the robotic
   platform;                and a sensor fusion processing unit (106). The 
   sensor fusion processing unit has: (i) a data               
   preprocessing unit (106a) configured to standardize                data
   format and correct sensor-specific errors;                (ii) a dynamic
   weight assignment unit (106b)                adjusting weights of sensor
   data based on factors                including sensor accuracy,
   reliability, and                environmental conditions, where the
   dynamic weight                assessment unit dynamically calculates
   sensor                weights based on environmental conditions, sensor 
   accuracy, and reliability assessments and assigns                weights
   to each sensor in real-time thus                integrating dynamically
   assigned weights with a                sensor fusion module and
   monitoring performance of                the dynamic weight assignment
   unit and adapting                weight adjustment criteria followed by
   adjusting                weights of sensor data; (iii) a fusion
   processor                (106c) configured to combine pre-processed
   sensor                data to generate a spatial unified perception     
   structure based on object recognition and                classification,
   information about environmental                conditions, real-time
   dynamics, multimodal data                fusion, and consideration of
   temporal aspects of                the robot's surroundings, where the
   fusion                processor identifies and classifies objects within
   the robot's surroundings using machine learning                models or
   deep neural networks thus collecting and                integrating data
   from environmental sensors to                capture information about
   lighting conditions,                weather, temperature, and other
   relevant parameters                and monitoring real-time dynamics,
   including the                movement of objects, changes in the robot's
   position, and alterations in the surroundings                followed by
   combining pre-processed sensor data                from various sensors
   and accounting for the                temporal aspects of the robot's
   surroundings by                incorporating time-sensitive data into
   the                perception structure and implementing techniques to  
   track changes over time and further synthesize               
   information from object recognition, environmental               
   conditions, real-time dynamics, multimodal data                fusion,
   and temporal considerations to create a                cohesive spatial
   representation; and (iv) a                real-time updating controller
   (106d) for continuous                adaptation to changing
   environmental conditions by                initializing the real-time
   updating controller to                establish a baseline configuration
   and set default                parameters and criteria for continuous   
   adaptation.An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method               
   for sensor fusion in a robotic platform.

   measuring wall thickness of two concentric            pipes used in e.g.

   and guided fluxes to            generate flux provided to analyzer
PN WO2024211788-A1; US2024337476-A1
AE SAUDI ARABIAN OIL CO; GOWELL INT LLC
AB 
   NOVELTY - The device has an electromagnetic transmitter               
   (161) to emit magnetic fluxes toward                electromagnetic
   receivers (161c). Focusing devices                i.e. magnets, focus
   the emitted magnetic flux to                compress and guide the
   emitted fluxes towards the                receivers. The receivers
   measure the compressed and                guided fluxes to generate a
   measured flux provided                to a pipe anomaly analyzer, where
   the emitting,                focusing and measuring processes are
   performed in                response to launching the device within an
   inner                pipe of two concentric pipes (172a, 172b). The     
   analyzer determines wall thickness of an outer pipe                based
   on the measured flux, and is embedded in a                downhole
   logging tool.
   USE - Pipe inspection device for use in a downhole               
   logging tool (claimed) for measuring wall thickness                of
   two concentric pipes used in oil and gas                applications,
   subsea applications and downhole                applications.
   ADVANTAGE - The device achieves improved accuracy on               
   high-quality and relevant data, thus leading to                improved
   accuracy in detecting leaks, classifying                defects, and
   predicting failures. The device                achieves real-time
   processing by optimizing                algorithms, real-time processing
   and                decision-making, thus allowing for quicker actions   
   in an event of a leak or failure, and hence                allowing for
   proactive maintenance and mitigation.                The device achieves
   cost savings in terms of                repairs, replacements, and
   environmental clean-up                by detecting leaks, classifying
   defects, and                predicting failures early. The device
   provides                improved safety by detecting and mitigating     
   potential failures early so as to improve safety of               
   pipeline operations and the surrounding                communities. The
   device can provide enhanced data                integration such that
   algorithms can be integrated                more effectively with
   existing pipeline management                systems, thus allowing
   seamless data exchange and                decision-making for different
   pipeline systems by                incorporating more diverse data
   sources.

   improve climate monitoring                through quantum optical
   sensors, which precisely                measure atmospheric gases, and
   quantum gravimeters,                which detect Earth's gravitational
   changes with                millimeter-level accuracy. The
   quantum-enhanced                spectroscopy and nitrogen-vacancy
   Magnetometers                'revolutionize pollution detection, for
   allowing                real-time air quality monitoring, water

   change mitigation. . The                interconnected quantum sensor

   comprehensive                pollution tracking and high-resolution

   from                multiple sensors, allowing for precise pollutant    
   source identification and intricate environmental               
   modeling. The system excels in monitoring critical               
   climate change indicators, including trace                greenhouse
   gases and polar ice mass fluctuations,                while also
   enabling real-time air and water quality                assessment. By
   providing environmental data of                superior accuracy and
   detail compared to                traditional methods, the network
   stands to                significantly improve decision-making processes
   in                environmental protection and climate change           
   mitigation. The span industrial emissions                monitoring,

   diverse sensors into a coherent and actionable               
   visualization platform, thus enhancing situational               
   awareness and decision-making capabilities for                border
   security personnel, addresses                vulnerabilities in
   underground scenarios by                integrating ground-penetrating
   radar (GPR) and                seismic sensors to detect tunneling
   activities,                with the deployment of drones equipped with
   GPR                capabilities further extending detection and         
   monitoring capabilities and to refine the main                system
   using machine learning to minimize false                alarms and
   improve overall effectiveness and to                minimize need for
   human intervention in hazardous                areas by utilizing
   autonomous patrolling                systems.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method    
   for performing surveillance and intruder detection               
   process to enhance security at national                borders.
   DESCRIPTION Of DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a schematic view of a     
   surveillance and intruder detection system for                enhancing
   security at national borders.

TI Internet of things (IoT)-enabled robotic system            for providing
   earthquake early warning and evaluating            infrastructure
   damage, has disaster monitoring and            response module that
   enables user to view early            warnings/alerts and infrastructure
   damage assessment            statistic reports
PN IN202441056498-A
AE UNIV GITAM
AB 
   NOVELTY - The system (100) has a cloud server (108)                which
   is configured to receive the preprocessed                real-time data
   and analyze it to identify patterns                indicative of seismic
   events and potential                infrastructure damage. The cloud
   server transmits                the analyzed data to each robot (102).
   An                earthquake predicting module (124) is configured to   
   generate early warnings/alerts and infrastructure                damage
   assessment statistic reports based on the                analyzed data.
   The earthquake predicting module                transmits the early
   warnings/alerts and                infrastructure damage assessment
   statistic reports                to multiple computing devices (104).
   Multiple                computing devices include a disaster monitoring
   and                response module configured to receive the early      
   warnings/alerts and infrastructure damage                assessment
   statistic reports. The disaster                monitoring and response
   module is configured to                enable user to view the early
   warnings/alerts and                infrastructure damage assessment
   statistic                reports.
   USE - Internet of things (IoT)-enabled robotic                system for
   providing earthquake early warning and                evaluating
   infrastructure damage.
   ADVANTAGE - The system integrates multiple sensor types               
   and advanced data fusion algorithms to improve the               
   accuracy and reliability of seismic activity                detection.
   The system enables timely issuance of                early warnings for
   impending earthquakes, allowing                for rapid evacuation and
   implementation of safety                measures to protect lives and
   property. The system                utilizes robotic platforms equipped
   with imaging                and ground-penetrating sensors to quickly
   and                accurately assess damage to infrastructure           
   immediately following an earthquake. The system                directed
   towards establishing a continuous                monitoring system for
   critical infrastructure,                identifying vulnerabilities, and
   supporting                preventive maintenance to enhance long-term   
   structural integrity. The system improves the                efficiency
   and effectiveness of emergency response                and resource
   allocation. The system deploys a                network of
   interconnected sensors to provide                extensive spatial
   coverage and heightened                sensitivity, overcoming the
   limitations of                traditional single-point sensor systems.
   The system                is directed towards designing a system with
   modular                architecture that can be adapted to various      
   environmental conditions and regions, ensuring               
   versatility and applicability in different seismic                risk
   areas. The system reduces labor costs,                minimizes
   subjective biases, and accelerates the                assessment
   timeline. The system integrates with                smart city networks
   for enhanced disaster                preparedness and resilience,
   supporting real-time                environmental monitoring and
   decision making. The                system allows quicker evacuation and
   implementation                of mitigation measures, thereby reducing
   the risk                to lives and property. The system enhances the  
   accuracy and completeness of damage assessments                compared
   to traditional manual inspections.
   DETAILED DESCRIPTION - An INDEPENDENT CLAIM is included for a method    
   for providing earthquake early warning and                evaluating
   infrastructure damage using an                IoT-enabled robotic
   system.
   DESCRIPTION Of DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a block diagram depicting
   a                schematic representation of an IoT enabled robotic     
   system for providing earthquake early warning and               
   evaluating infrastructure damage.100IoT-enabled robotic
   system102Robot104Computing devices108Cloud server124Earthquake
   predicting module

TI Intelligent control method of civil defense door            used as key
   facility in protection, isolation and            evacuation, involves
   determining current surrounding            environment of civil defense
   door, and outputting final            control decision which is basic
   control decision            corresponding to environment
PN CN118709015-A
AE XI'AN ZHENGTAI FIVE ANTI-ENG CO LTD
AB 
   NOVELTY - The method involves using a surrounding               
   environment perception module to obtain real-time               
   surrounding environment data. The real-time                surrounding
   environment data is processed through                the data processing
   unit including filtering,                denoising, standardizing data,
   feature extraction                and data fusion, and obtain feature
   fusion data.                The feature fusion data is analyzed using
   machine                learning algorithms through the decision support 
   system. The current surrounding environment of the                civil
   defense door is determined, and the final                control
   decision is outputted. The final control                decision is the
   basic control decision                corresponding to the environment,
   if the current                surrounding environment is one
   environment. The                final control decision is a combination
   of basic                control decisions corresponding to multiple     
   environments, if the current surrounding                environment is a
   combination of multiple                environments.
   USE - Intelligent control method of civil defense                door
   used as key facility in protection, isolation                and
   evacuation.
   ADVANTAGE - The method realizes the intelligent control of              
   the civil defense door by fusing multiple data, and               
   applies advanced machine learning algorithm and               
   optimizing model training process, and improves the               
   stability and reliability of the system while                ensuring
   the safety of the personnel, and improves                the response
   speed and precision of the                system.
   DESCRIPTION Of DRAWING(S) - The drawing shows a flowchart illustrating  
   the intelligent control method of civil defense                door used
   as key facility in protection, isolation                and evacuation.
   (Drawing includes non-English                language text)
